item.title: The LASALLE Show will begin in April 2019
item.description: From the beginning of April to the end of May, the public and industry professionals are invited to view almost 900 graduating student projects at Singapore’s LASALLE College of the Arts yearly graduation showcase. The projects featured at The LASALLE Show are developed throughout the students’ final year and embody the culmination of their artistic growth and the realization of their aspirations. The LASALLE Show also provides insights into current trends in contemporary arts and design and highlights the emerging work of young artists.

item.title: In 2021, digitalization will be the driving force behind recruitment in Singapore
item.description: Randstad Singapore’s 2021 Market Outlook Report examines the economic and hiring trends anticipated for 2021. Jaya Dass, Managing Director for Randstad Malaysia and Singapore, emphasizes that digital transformation will be a key driver of talent demand in 2021. She predicts a surge in demand for tech professionals and digitally skilled individuals across various sectors. While acknowledging the cautious optimism of businesses in the wake of the pandemic, Dass highlights the need for agility and innovation to adapt to the evolving landscape.

item.title: Improve efficiency in the hospitality and retail industries with Epson solutions
item.description: Epson Singapore, a company that provides point-of-sale (POS) and labeling printers, presented its newest POS solutions at Food&HotelAsia2016 (FHA2016), a major trade show in Asia for food and hospitality products. Their aim was to demonstrate how these solutions could make operations smoother and more cost-effective for the food and hospitality sectors. At FHA2016, Epson collaborated with system integrators Enterprise Advance System Intelligence (EASI) and POS Square to design their booth as a theme park.

item.title: Singtel provides leasing options for high-end smartphones
item.description: Singtel has introduced Singapore’s first mobile phone leasing program to make high-end devices more accessible. Subscribers with SIM Only plans can choose to pay a low monthly fee to use premium Apple and Samsung handsets instead of buying them outright. They can lease the newest Apple iPhone and Samsung Galaxy models for two years and have the option to upgrade in the twelfth month for a S$200 fee. With prices starting at S$35 per month for a Samsung Galaxy S9 (64 GB), customers can save up to S$578 off the regular retail price if they lease the phone for a year or S$358 if they keep it for two years.

item.title: Join us at Smile Singapore in Clarke Quay Central and share your beautiful smile with us!
item.description: The installation of the Smile project at Clarke Quay Central is currently underway. Clarke Quay Central mall is promoting a happier Singapore with its Smile Singapore campaign. Launched as part of Singapore’s Jubilee celebrations, this project gives companies a platform to share their happy moments in the nation. Caine Teo, head of Ape Works, the Creative Partner of the Smile Singapore Campaign, believes happiness is infectious. By showcasing pictures of smiling faces, they hope to remind Singaporeans of the many reasons to smile in their country.

item.title: SIM Global Education hosts information sessions on smart city design
item.description: SIM Global Education (SIM GE) is hosting informational meetings with industry experts for individuals interested in their Master in Design for Smart Cities program in Singapore, a collaborative offering with the Strate School of Design from France. A series of online discussions will be held featuring: urban planning expert Yann Follain on October 2nd, Airbus’s Cyrille Schwob on October 24th, sustainable smart cities specialist Pablo Viejo on October 28th, and PSA Peugeot Citroen’s Gregory Blokkeel, focusing on smart city mobility, on November 8th.

item.title: Changi Airport Group announces the closure of Terminal 2 for a period of 18 months
item.description: Source: CAG. Changi Airport. Due to a significant decrease in air travel and the low likelihood of a return to pre-pandemic levels soon, Changi Airport Group (CAG) has decided to consolidate operations at Changi Airport. This move aims to reduce operating costs like utilities and cleaning for CAG and its partners while optimizing resource allocation across the airport’s terminals. Starting May 1, 2020, Terminal 2 (T2) will halt operations for 18 months, relocating airlines to other terminals*.

item.title: Singaporean IT leaders are concerned that a shortage of skills could impede the progress of the Smart Nation initiative
item.description: 93% of Singaporean Chief Information Officers (CIOs) are worried that Singapore lacks the IT talent pool needed to successfully implement Smart Nation initiatives. Six out of 10 CIOs believe Smart Nation initiatives will lead to more IT jobs, and 53% believe these initiatives will boost average IT salaries. New independent research* commissioned by specialized recruiter Robert Half reveals that over 9 in 10 (93%) Singaporean IT leaders are concerned about the lack of readily available IT talent in Singapore to build a Smart Nation-ready workforce.

item.title: Singtel and DBS have attracted a record number of small and medium-sized enterprises for the 99% SME Shopping Week
item.description: Source: Singtel. Pictured showing support for the 99% SME Shopping Week 2017 are (from left): Ted Tan, Deputy Chief Executive of SPRING Singapore; Yeo Hiang Meng, President of the Federation of Merchants’ Association of Singapore; Joyce Tee, Managing Director and Group Head of SME Banking at DBS Bank; Sim Ann, Senior Minister of State for the Ministry of Trade and Industry and Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth; Andrew Lim, Managing Director of Business Group, Group Enterprise at Singtel; and Parminder Singh, Chief Commercial and Digital Officer of Mediacorp.

item.title: In 2017, a settlement network powered by blockchain announced that it would waive fees for transfers to Singapore
item.description: OKLink, a global settlement platform, has introduced the first entirely free remittance corridor. The company stated that transfers up to US$100,000 each month to Singapore will be free throughout 2017. Previously, OKLink applied a 0.1% fee on cross-border payments to Singapore, while other companies might charge up to US$5 per transaction. “As the world’s largest blockchain-powered global settlement network, we can process cross-border payments faster and more affordably as more partners join,” explained Jack Liu, Chief Strategy Officer at OKLink.

item.title: HTC introduces smartphone and imaging ecosystem components in Singapore
item.description: HTC debuted its new camera, the RE, alongside the HTC Desire EYE smartphone, HTC Eye Experience imaging software, and Zoe, a collaborative video editing community, in Singapore. Jack Yang, President of South Asia, HTC Corporation, stated that similar to how HTC allowed people to replace laptops with smartphones in 1997, HTC is again revolutionizing technology by offering powerful hardware coupled with exceptional software. He emphasized HTC’s aim to change the way we perceive imaging — taking users beyond the viewfinder and placing them in the midst of the action with innovative software that enhances the use of technology.

item.title: Orchard Road in Singapore is adorned with Christmas lights
item.description: Singapore’s Orchard Road is aglow with Disney magic this holiday season. The “Disney Magical Moments — Christmas on A Great Street!” celebration features illuminated displays of beloved characters. The lights were officially switched on the evening of November 10. Here’s a glimpse of the Toy Story-themed lights outside Plaza Singapura from the opening night. The lights are arranged in four color-themed zones: - Orange: Pixar’s Toy Story characters, including Woody, Buzz Lightyear, and their friends.

item.title: Tea Forté Singapore presents three mooncake collections as part of the Autumn in Abundance series
item.description: Source: Tea Forté. Tea Forté Singapore, a specialty tea company, has introduced its new Autumn in Abundance mooncake collection, featuring traditional baked mooncakes with reduced sugar, the Creative Infused line, and a special Luxury selection. The company suggests pairing the traditional mooncakes with its organic white ginger pear tea, the Creative Infused collection with the organic green mango peach tea, and the Luxurious selections with its orchid vanilla tea.

item.title: The FastGig app has been released to connect flexible workers with job opportunities
item.description: FastCo, the company known for its Asian non-executive job platform FastJobs, has launched FastGig, an app designed for the expanding gig economy. FastCo claims this is one of the first apps specifically for gig workers in Southeast Asia. FastGig, operating as Singapore’s first workforce-as-a-service (WaaS) platform, connects skilled flexible workers with companies facing staffing shortages, particularly during peak seasons. Julian Tan, FastCo’s Founder & CEO, highlights FastGig as a solution to a significant market gap, providing flexibility for both workers and businesses and transforming Singapore’s gig economy.

item.title: Delicious Medallions from Swensen's
item.description: Swensen’s is offering early bird discounts on their chocolate-covered Sweet Medallions mooncakes until September 20th, 2017. The mooncakes are available in a variety of flavors like cookies ’n cream surprise, durian royale, Rocher crunch, and sticky chewy chocolate. Source: Swensen’s website. Four chocolate-covered flavours are on offer in Swensen’s mooncake collection for 2017. Place your order to take advantage of the 20% early bird discount available to Swensen’s Cool Rewards and Kids’ Club members.

item.title: BEAM offers self-storage services in Singapore through a mobile app
item.description: BEAM, a new self-storage company, has launched in Singapore, offering a unique approach to traditional storage solutions. Their services are managed entirely through a mobile app. Unlike conventional self-storage providers that lease fixed spaces, BEAM offers flexible per-item storage. This means users only pay for the space their belongings occupy, eliminating wasted costs. Additionally, while traditional facilities are often inconveniently located, BEAM provides free pick-up and delivery to their secure 6,000 sq ft facility, equipped with CCTV and access control.

item.title: Success in business relies on establishing a broad network, having a strong passion, dedicating time, and learning from numerous failures
item.description: Alex Foo, co-founder of the entrepreneur-focused psychometric profiling tool Starteur, offers three key tips for entrepreneurial success. These insights, derived from both his attendance at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2016 (June 22-24, USA) and his personal journey as a young entrepreneur, were shared during a Shopee University session. Foo’s trip to GES 2016 was sponsored by Shopee, the e-commerce platform by Garena. This sponsorship reflects Shopee’s commitment to nurturing the next generation of Singaporean entrepreneurs.

item.title: Starting October 14, the Coffee Lounge at Goodwood Park Hotel will be offering an expanded menu
item.description: Singapore’s Goodwood Park Hotel, home to the Coffee Lounge known for its Taiwan porridge and local dishes, is launching a limited-time menu enhancement. From October 14th, guests can enjoy new additions to the “Design Your Own Local Degustation Set Menu” and a special dessert buffet featuring Mao Shan Wang durian. This year, from October 14th to November 17th, Coffee Lounge’s popular dessert buffet will showcase Mao Shan Wang durian pastries alongside its regular offerings during lunch and dinner.

item.title: Beads Actually is introducing a special merlion bead in celebration of SG50, available for a limited time only
item.description: The Singaporean store Beads Actually is offering pre-orders for a merlion bead from OHM Beads. The merlion, a creature with a lion’s head and a fish’s body and tail, is a well-known symbol of Singapore. Only two hundred of these beads are available, exclusively through Beads Actually from July 2nd to July 31st. Following this period, it will be available for individual purchase globally. The bead, priced at S$110, is included in a starter kit featuring either a plain bangle or a snap-clasp bracelet.

item.title: Singapore gets a sneak peek at the HUAWEI Mate 20 icon before its official launch
item.description: Source: Huawei. The square icon at various malls in Singapore. People in Singapore were introduced to the distinctive HUAWEI Mate 20 Matrix Camera System through an unexpected display of an illuminated square icon projected onto buildings throughout the city over the weekend. This symbolic imagery appeared on structures in various locations such as Raffles City, Bugis Junction, Bugis+, and Plaza Singapura. This readily identifiable square represents the phone’s camera setup, which includes a Leica Triple Camera and flash seamlessly integrated into the back of the HUAWEI Mate 20 series smartphones.

item.title: Bookmate has teamed up with StarHub for its initial launch in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Source: Bookmate. Pictured at the December 17 launch of Bookmate in Singapore are (from left): Simon Dunlop, Bookmate Founder, Andrew Baev, Bookmate Managing Director, and Michael Sim, StarHub Lead Futurist, i3 (Innovation, Investment, Incubation). Bookmate, a social platform for reading e-books, has launched in Singapore, its initial entry point into the Southeast Asian market. The service offers subscribers unlimited reading for a fixed monthly price, drawing from a library of over half a million e-books provided by 600 publishers.

item.title: Preorder the HUAWEI Matebook X Pro now in Singapore
item.description: Huawei Consumer Business Group is introducing the HUAWEI MateBook X Pro to its Singapore laptop collection. Until August 16, 2020, customers can take advantage of special gift packages worth S$250 to S$1,200 when they purchase select laptops. The premium MateBook X Pro boasts a sleek, metallic design with a sandblasted finish. At just 14.6 mm thick and 1.33 kg, it prioritizes portability without sacrificing a truly immersive viewing experience. Source: Huawei.

item.title: Singapore is implementing measures to ensure that esports becomes a profitable industry
item.description: Source: SCOGA. From left: Matthias Beyer, Partnerships Lead, Southeast Asia at Twitch, Dennis Ooi, Honorary Secretary of (Singapore) Cybersports & Online Gaming Association (SCOGA), Kelvin Tan, President and Co-Founder of SCOGA, Nicholas Khoo, Chairman and Co-Founder of SCOGA, Raiford Cockfield III, Director of APAC Partnerships at Twitch, and Dr Charles Ling, COO, Informatics Education. As esports’ popularity explodes globally, the (Singapore) Cybersports & Online Gaming Association (SCOGA) has established new partnerships to cultivate Singapore’s esports landscape.

item.title: Singtel will be providing the option to share up to 50GB of mobile data at the PC Show 2016
item.description: Singtel is increasing its mobile data offerings with the launch of “DataMore,” a new plan featuring larger data bundles. This launch comes less than a month after Circles.Life entered the market with a focus on data options. DataMore is designed for users who need a lot of data and is shareable with multiple users, making it perfect for families. Diana Chen, Singtel’s Vice President of Mobile Marketing, highlights that this plan caters to customer demand for larger data packages at affordable prices.

item.title: Singapore is invited to a new year countdown at Clarke Quay
item.description: Source: Clarke Quay. Clarke Quay invites everyone in Singapore to celebrate the end of the year with exciting festivities. Popular radio DJs Glenn Ong from Class95FM and Sonia Chew from 987FM will host the New Year’s Eve countdown. The event will feature live music by the band Goodfellas, a vibrant street parade with a glow theme, and roving percussionists. The entire event at Clarke Quay will be broadcasted live on 987FM.

item.title: Singtel TV broadens its entertainment offerings with TVB programming
item.description: Singtel TV is adding Hong Kong’s TVB Jade and TVB Xing He channels to its lineup. From September 9th to October 8th, 2019, viewers can enjoy a free preview. Singtel customers will have access to the same TVB Jade as Hong Kong viewers, featuring Cantonese dramas, variety shows, and infotainment programs. Yuen Kuan Moon, Singtel’s CEO of Consumer Singapore, shared that the company is fulfilling customer requests by introducing these channels, broadening their comprehensive TV offerings and solidifying their position as Singapore’s leading pay-TV provider.

item.title: In January, StarHub will be featuring high-definition Korean movies
item.description: StarHub TV customers will be the first in Asia to enjoy the latest and greatest Korean films in high definition (HD), 24 hours a day. The company announced that tvN Movies HD, Asia’s first channel dedicated to Korean films, will launch on StarHub TV (channel 818) on January 11, 2017. For added convenience, the channel will also be available on demand as tvN Movies VOD HD. Customers can watch it anytime on StarHub TV Channel 819, or stream it via StarHub Go, StarHub’s online streaming service.

item.title: 2018 Singapore Last-Minute Christmas Gift Guide
item.description: As the year comes to a close, many are preparing for holiday festivities. If you’re still searching for the perfect gifts or party essentials, look no further! Party Accessories Creative Home Genuine Marble Stone, S$55.20 Source: Amazon. Creative home genuine marble stone. This stylish marble disc serves as a sophisticated base for cheese platters, keeping your appetizers cool and visually appealing. Source: Amazon. Nutcracker napkins. Michel Design Works Paper Luncheon Napkin, Nutcracker, S$11.

item.title: Robert Walters reports that there is still a high demand for talent in Singapore
item.description: Robert Walters, a recruitment firm, has published its Asia Job Index for the first quarter of 2015, highlighting that finding and hiring local talent remains a top concern in Singapore. The Asia Job Index monitors the number of job postings for professional roles across major job sites and national newspapers in China, Hong Kong, Japan, Malaysia, and Singapore. Toby Fowlston, Managing Director of Robert Walters Southeast Asia, noted that recruitment in Singapore is primarily driven by competition for a limited pool of candidates, making it challenging to attract the most qualified individuals for the right positions.

item.title: AquaMarine in Singapore offers a selection of nutritious buffet options
item.description: Source: Marina Mandarin by Meritus. This April, AquaMarine, the restaurant located in Singapore’s luxurious 5-star Marina Mandarin hotel, is putting a spotlight on healthy dining. Their halal-certified buffet features a variety of fresh, organic ingredients. Through the end of April, AquaMarine diners can enjoy live cooking stations, fresh seafood, Singaporean favorites, and international dishes, all prepared with a healthy approach. For instance, the popular chicken rice at the Chinese live station is served with brown rice, and wholewheat flour is used for pasta and tortillas.

item.title: Singapore and Japan will work together to promote collaboration and assist in the development of businesses and startups
item.description: Singapore’s Economic Development Board (EDB) and Enterprise Singapore have partnered with the Japan External Trade Organisation (JETRO) to enhance support for startups and businesses in both Singapore and Japan. This agreement was formalized during the ASEAN Economic Ministers’ Meeting 2018. The collaboration aims to create opportunities for startups and businesses by facilitating information exchange and organizing joint initiatives and events. This will strengthen the connection between the innovation ecosystems of Singapore and Japan.

item.title: Singtel increases its offering of free content as the circuit-breaker in Singapore is extended
item.description: Singtel TV is expanding its free preview by adding 10 more channels while the circuit breaker period is extended. This is in addition to the 95,000 hours of programming already offered for free on Singtel TV and Singtel CAST, which was launched last month to help entertain people stuck at home. From May 1st to 31st, Singtel TV and Singtel TV GO will offer a free preview with more entertainment, factual, news, and other programming from popular channels including National Geographic and FOX Family Movies.

item.title: AirAsia introduces three new exclusive routes with a 20% discount on all flights until February 16th
item.description: AirAsia is the sole airline offering flights for three new routes: Johor Bahru to Tawau, Singapore to Kota Bharu, and Singapore to Terengganu. The airline is currently promoting these routes with fares as low as RM69* for travel between Johor Bahru and Tawau. This offer is valid for bookings made before February 16th, 2014, for travel dates between April 18th, 2014 and January 31st, 2015. Welcome banners at Changi Airport

item.title: Use #GrabTaxi to #GrabDurian in Singapore on August 1 and 2
item.description: Source: GrabTaxi. GrabTaxi, a popular taxi booking app in Southeast Asia, is giving back to its loyal Singaporean users with a special durian treat. For a limited time on August 1st and 2nd, customers can order a box of fresh Mao Shan Wang durian through the GrabTaxi app for S$10. Deliveries will be carried out by a dedicated GrabCar durian fleet throughout the island. Orders can be placed between 2 pm and 9 pm, but availability is limited, so early ordering is recommended.

item.title: Three new programs to assist Singaporean businesses in their digital transformation efforts
item.description: Singapore has launched new initiatives to boost digitalization among its enterprises, especially small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), which are considered the backbone of the nation’s economy. S Iswaran, Singapore’s Minister for Communications and Information, announced three key initiatives at an industry networking event. Minister Iswaran delivering the opening address. The Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) and Enterprise Singapore launched “Start Digital”, an initiative under the “SMEs Go Digital” program. Start Digital will give new SMEs a head start by providing two free foundational digital solutions for a minimum of six months.

item.title: BenQ introduces new digital signage, projectors, and interactive flat panels, creating a buzz
item.description: BenQ, a leading provider of visual display technology, has introduced a range of new projectors, digital signage, and interactive flat panels, all emphasizing high quality and innovative design. The company highlighted its commitment to delivering excellent visual experiences across various sectors, including business, retail, and food & beverage. Business The MX666+ projector. The MX666+ is the first wireless business projector to feature Near Field Communication (NFC) technology and USB connectivity, making it ideal for bring-your-own-device environments.

item.title: Golden Equator Consulting assists small and medium-sized enterprises and startups in advancing towards success
item.description: Golden Equator Consulting (GE Consulting), a business consultancy firm, has established a presence in Singapore to serve small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and startups in the region. Sharon Chong, CEO of GE Consulting, noted that these businesses need strategic and operational support to streamline their growth and focus on core business functions. GE Consulting offers comprehensive business consultancy services, covering areas such as business strategy, sales positioning, financial support, marketing, technology, human resources, and legal compliance.

item.title: The Butchers Club Burger offers National Day dishes in celebration of Singapore's 51st anniversary
item.description: The Butchers Club Burger in Singapore is launching a special menu item for National Day: The Little Red Dot Burger. Starting July 29th and lasting for two weekends, The Little Red Dot Burger will be featured as part of a National Day Set Menu at The Butchers Club Burger Singapore. This marks the restaurant’s first National Day celebration in Singapore, and the burger itself is a tribute to a beloved local dish: satay ayam (chicken satay).

item.title: Aon announces the recipients of the Aon Best Employers Singapore 2017 award
item.description: Employee engagement at companies recognized as Aon Best Employers rose by two percentage points this year, reaching 82%. Aon Best Employers are setting the standard for positive employer branding, achieving scores from 83% to 92% in employee perception across all levels of tenure. Five special recognitions were given this year, including the introduction of a new award category: Best Employer for Startups. Source: Aon. Aon Best Employers Singapore 2017.

item.title: OPPO empowers Singaporeans to discover the ultimate experience with #UncoverTheUltimate
item.description: Last week, OPPO, a global provider of smart devices, introduced its latest lineup of smartphones, including the brand’s first 5G offering, the Find X2 Pro 5G, and a new addition to its creative Reno series, the Reno3. This unveiling follows the global online launch of the Find X2 series on March 6. The Find X2 Pro boasts a 120 Hz QHD AMOLED screen, 65 W SuperVOOC Flash Charge 2.0 technology, and the Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 processor, delivering an enhanced overall photography and video experience.

item.title: Book appointments through Vaniday
item.description: Source: Vaniday. Vaniday has been launched in Singapore. Vaniday, a platform for beauty and wellness services, has expanded to Singapore, its first market in Southeast Asia. The company recently secured €15 million in initial funding to support its growth. Vaniday wants to change how people find, book, and experience beauty and wellness services. The app and website allow users to browse a wide selection of salons and book appointments directly from the salon’s schedule.

item.title: Unveiling the intricate nyonya needlework at the Peranakan Museum in Singapore
item.description: This image, from the Peranakan Museum website, shows an example of Nyonya needlework. The “Nyonya Needlework: Embroidery and Beadwork in the Peranakan World” exhibition is currently on display at the Peranakan Museum in Singapore until March 26, 2017. This exhibition showcases the artistry of Nyonya needlework, a significant aspect of Peranakan Chinese culture. Elaborate curtains, wall hangings, delicate purses, handkerchiefs, and slippers are meticulously crafted with tiny beads, silk, gold, and silver threads.

item.title: Experience a unique twist on French-inspired dining this holiday season at Sofitel So Singapore
item.description: Source: Sofitel So Singapore. Paulo. At Sofitel So Singapore, Xperience restaurant’s head chef, Trevor Paulo, is celebrating his first Christmas season at the hotel with a special four-course Christmas Eve dinner. The dinner starts with a small bite of blinis topped with dill yogurt and herring roe. The first course is a visually appealing dish of house-cured Salmon Gravlax arranged to look like a miniature garden with edible truffle “soil” and pickled shallots.

item.title: Reserve a magical Disney experience aboard the Disney Adventure through Traveloka
item.description: Starting in the fourth quarter of 2024, travelers can book voyages with Disney Cruise Lines departing from Singapore through the Traveloka app, according to an announcement from the Southeast Asian travel platform. This addition to Traveloka’s offerings reinforces the company’s dedication to showcasing the diverse experiences and attractions available in Singapore. Launching in late 2025, the Disney Adventure will call Singapore its home port. The ship boasts seven themed areas with Disney-themed dining and exciting onboard activities.

item.title: Anticipate more sustainable and environmentally-friendly buildings in Singapore
item.description: The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) announced new initiatives during the opening ceremony of Singapore Green Building Week (SGBW). These initiatives, stemming from a review of the third Green Building Masterplan, focus on improving occupant indoor environmental quality, promoting energy-efficient buildings, and incorporating green practices into existing structures. Desmond Lee, Singapore’s Minister for Social and Family Development and Second Minister for National Development, was the guest of honor at the ceremony.

item.title: Nanu, the free calling app, provides a fresh approach to connecting with customers
item.description: Source: nanu website. Nanu, the first entirely free mobile calling app, is experiencing rapid growth in its monthly and daily active users. Based in Singapore, the startup claims its app’s active user rates are almost twice the industry standard, with 56% monthly active users and 19% daily active users. CEO Martin Nygate points out that many tech startups avoid disclosing these figures due to poor performance. He’s pleased to share nanu’s positive data, reflecting both strong download numbers and increasing app usage.

item.title: ARTWALK Little India combines elements of the past with modern influences
item.description: Source: ARTWALK Little India. Izzad Radzali Shah, Festival, ARTWALK Little India 2018, LASALLE College of the Arts, 2018. Photo: Ng Wu Gang. The multidisciplinary arts festival ARTWALK Little India is a collaboration between LASALLE College of the Arts (LASALLE) and the Singapore Tourism Board (STB), with support from the Little India Shopkeepers and Heritage Association. It returns for its fourth year in January 2018 as a featured event in Singapore Art Week.

item.title: The Imperial Hotel in Japan is targeting visitors from Southeast Asia
item.description: Source: Imperial Hotel website. The established Imperial Hotel of Japan has launched its inaugural full-service sales office in Southeast Asia to bolster its marketing endeavors within the ASEAN region. Imperial Hotel, Ltd., the company behind the globally acclaimed Imperial Hotel in Tokyo (established in 1890), the recently opened Imperial Hotel in Osaka, and other smaller hotels, along with a mountain resort in the Japan Alps, is expanding its reach.

item.title: Singapore and Jiangsu strengthen economic ties
item.description: The Singapore-Jiangsu Cooperation Council (SJCC) aims to boost opportunities for companies from both regions in areas like collaboration in third-party markets, trade and logistics, and financial services. This contributes to the existing Singapore-Jiangsu economic partnership and advances the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). Thirteen memoranda of understanding (MoUs) reflect these goals. Singapore’s Finance Minister, Heng Swee Keat, who is also SJCC Co-Chairman, emphasized the strong, enduring relationship between Singapore and Jiangsu.

item.title: The Singapore Gifts Show will be running until July 11th
item.description: The Singapore Gifts Show 2014 (SGS), now in its ninth year, will focus on showcasing products designed in Singapore and local businesses. The show, supported by the DesignSingapore Council, will feature many Singapore-made gifts, including a new gift and souvenir line called Now & Then. Celcem, led by designer and Singaporean entrepreneur Edwin Low, owner of the local retail boutique Supermama, spearheads this new label. Low, the recipient of the President’s Design Award in 2013, runs Supermama, the studio responsible for the President’s Design Award’s ‘Singapore Icons’ souvenir collection.

item.title: According to Accenture, gaining digital skills could help reduce the gender gap by up to 40 years faster
item.description: Source: Accenture. Closing the gender gap at work. According to Accenture research, digital skills and technologies are empowering women in Singapore to secure and progress in their careers. However, a wage disparity persists, with men earning more. Ranked 5th out of 31 countries in Accenture’s research, Singaporean women demonstrate significant progress in digital fluency, reflecting their adoption and utilization of digital tools for knowledge acquisition, networking, and enhanced efficiency.

item.title: Some businesses are finding success with crowdfunding
item.description: Crowdfunding, particularly through platforms like Kickstarter, has proven very successful for certain entrepreneurs. The typical project presents a concept and images of the product in development and seeks funding from backers. Both entrepreneurs and their backers can be located anywhere globally. Funding is usually sought through tiered pledges, where higher pledges receive products with additional features. This process is often gamified with “stretch goals,” where exceeding funding targets unlocks new rewards for all backers at specific milestones.

item.title: Singapore is taking steps to enhance its resilience
item.description: Concept classroom by dream by WOMBO. Singapore’s Budget 2023 centers around navigating global economic uncertainties by enhancing the country’s productivity and competitiveness. Singapore’s Deputy PM and Finance Minister, Lawrence Wong, highlighted the US ban on advanced chip technology transfer to China and its ripple effects. He stated, “We are seeing a fierce competition for dominance in critical technologies, likely to intensify, leading to a concerning trend toward increased economic nationalism and protectionism worldwide.

item.title: Successful demonstration of augmented reality video calls over long distances using 5G technology
item.description: Source: Singtel. An Optus engineer at Optus’ live 5G site in Sydney, Australia conducts a 5G augmented reality video call using an OPPO 5G test device with Singtel engineers in Singapore. Singtel, Optus, and Ericsson have given a glimpse into the future of communication by making a successful 5G video call with augmented reality (AR) between Singapore and Australia. This call, using OPPO 5G test devices equipped with Qualcomm 5G modems on both countries’ 5G networks, demonstrates the potential of real-time AR on 5G networks built by Ericsson.

item.title: RENEW e-recycling initiative in Singapore grows
item.description: Four major electronics retailers in Singapore – Best Denki, COURTS, Gain City, and Harvey Norman – have partnered with DHL, StarHub, and TES to expand the RENEW e-waste recycling program. By placing RENEW bins in 20 of their stores, these retailers aim to make e-waste recycling more accessible to the public. RENEW, which stands for REcycling the Nation’s Electronic Waste, is a collaborative effort by DHL, StarHub, and TES to promote responsible disposal of electronic devices and ICT equipment.

item.title: Investing in corporate bonds will be made more accessible for Singaporean investors
item.description: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has launched two new regulations aimed at making it easier for retail investors – individuals who purchase securities for personal investment purposes – to participate in corporate bond offerings. These changes are part of MAS’s broader strategy to expand retail investors’ investment choices by providing access to simpler, lower-risk investment products. Corporate issuers typically rely on the wholesale bond market for funding due to the higher expenses associated with reaching retail investors.

item.title: A new e-trading platform for physical commodities, based on blockchain technology, has been launched in Singapore on a global scale
item.description: The Commodities Intelligence Centre (CIC) has introduced Singapore’s first physical commodity business-to-business (B2B) e-trading platform in collaboration with key partners: Zall Smartcomm, a prominent B2B player in China; Global eTrade Services (GeTS) Asia, a subsidiary of CrimsonLogic; and Singapore Exchange (SGX). Enterprise Singapore played a crucial role in bringing these partners together. CIC offers a comprehensive global trading platform powered by Blockchain technology. This platform provides commodity traders worldwide with a range of services, including transaction matching, simplified customs clearance, supply chain financing, flexible payment options, and enhanced resource pooling for both buyers and sellers.

item.title: Celebrate National Day with Amara Sanctuary Singapore's special promotion!
item.description: Source: Amara Sanctuary Resort Sentosa. Singapore laksa. To commemorate Singapore’s 53rd birthday, the 5-star Amara Sanctuary Resort Sentosa is offering a National Day special at their Shutters restaurant. During this National Day celebration, Shutters’ dinner guests will enjoy a discounted Singapura buffet, priced at S$53++ per adult, down from the usual S$75++. This offer is valid from 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm. The buffet features local favorites like Nyonya laksa, barbequed stingray, and charcoal-grilled satay.

item.title: Circles.Life introduces a range of new services centered around unlimited usage
item.description: For S$3, enjoy unlimited on-demand data at 4G+ speeds. For the first time, get unlimited WhatsApp roaming in 18 countries for S$1 per day. Source: Circles.Life. Poster for Unlimited Data on Demand. Circles.Life, Singapore’s fourth mobile operator, argues that the current unlimited data plans are actually quite restrictive. They believe that these plans should not be limited to weekends, slowed down after a small data limit, or tied to yearly contracts.

item.title: Five years later, Club HEAL still works to raise awareness about mental health
item.description: Club HEAL, a volunteer-based organization, recently celebrated its fifth anniversary with a gala dinner. Almost 600 guests and supporters attended. Dr. Radiah Salim, the founder and president of Club HEAL, stated that the organization strives to address as many service gaps as possible. She shared that approximately 2,000 individuals have benefited from Club HEAL’s assistance. Her hope is to see more Club HEAL locations while expanding their outreach to those facing addiction challenges.

item.title: Celebrate National Day with the One Lagi Best Deal!
item.description: Source: One Faber Group. Cable car visual. In honor of Singapore’s 52nd birthday, One Faber Group is offering the One Lagi Best Deal, featuring local promotions on its leisure activities and services from Faber Peak Singapore to Sentosa Island. Until September 17th, Singaporeans* can take advantage of a special offer: a S$52 bundle for adults and a S$42 bundle for children. The adult bundle includes a round-trip Singapore cable car ride, a standard ticket to the Wings Of Time show, a standard ticket to Sentosa Merlion, a three-course meal at the Good Old Days restaurant, and a batik orchid magnet.

item.title: The new bronze pink Xperia XZ Premium phones are now on sale in Singapore
item.description: Source: Sony. The Bronze Pink Sony Xperia XZ. After the June release of the Sony Xperia XZ Premium, Sony Mobile has launched a third color option in Singapore: Bronze Pink. This new pink-hued phone will be available at select retailers starting July 8th. The Xperia XZ Premium has a suggested retail price of S$1,098. Sony claims its Xperia XZ Premium is the world’s fastest smartphone, boasting a 4K HDR display.

item.title: The HTC Desire 210, an entry-level dual SIM phone, is priced at less than S$160
item.description: HTC will launch its budget-friendly smartphone, the HTC Desire 210, in Singapore on Wednesday, September 3, 2014. The phone will be sold through various retailers in two colors: Stealth Black and Polar White. A notable feature of the Desire 210 is its dual SIM card support, allowing users to manage personal and work profiles easily from a single device. Source: HTC. “The HTC Desire 210 brings impressive technology and design to the entry-level smartphone market,” stated Jack Yang, President of HTC South Asia.

item.title: Starting today, Singtel will be accepting preorders for the Google Pixel 2 XL
item.description: Singtel announced a partnership with Google to become the official telecommunications provider for the highly anticipated Google Pixel 2 XL in Singapore. Starting November 15th, Singtel customers will have the exclusive opportunity to be the first in Southeast Asia to purchase this new device. Yuen Kuan Moon, Singtel’s Chief Executive Officer for Consumer Singapore, expressed excitement about bringing the Pixel 2 XL to Singapore, highlighting its innovative features that have been eagerly awaited by Android fans.

item.title: Epson Singapore is sponsoring limited edition prints for The Schooling Effect
item.description: Source: Epson Singapore. From left: Tan May Lin, Epson Singapore’s GM (Sales, Marketing & Customer Service Division) and Tay Kay Chin, one of the collaborators for the photo book, with one of the prints available for sale as part of the collaboration. Epson Singapore, a company that provides digital imaging and printing solutions, is supporting The Schooling Effect. This community project is inspired by the victory of Singaporean Olympian Joseph Schooling at the 2016 Olympic Games.

item.title: In March, Dario Cecchini explores culinary partnerships
item.description: The renowned Bottega di Carna at the Mondrian Singapore Duxton, known for its unique dining experience crafted by “World’s Greatest Butcher” Dario Cecchini, is excited to announce upcoming collaborations this March. The restaurant’s philosophy centers around respecting the entire animal and utilizing traditional methods to showcase the finest produce and ingredients. Cecchini Returns with Exciting Collaborations Bottega di Carna X Bold & Braised Hawker Pop-up March 6th-7th Cecchini and Bottega di Carna’s Head Chef Kenny Huang are joining forces with local Chinatown eatery Bold & Braised at Maxwell Food Centre.

item.title: Flight Experience Singapore and McGallen & Bolden offer unique leadership workshops that stand out from the rest
item.description: Source: McGallen & Bolden. Flight Experience Singapore, the first flight simulator open to the public in Asia, has partnered with the consulting firm McGallen & Bolden to offer leadership workshops. Their program, Leadership Secrets at 30,000 Feet, is designed for business leaders and executives. It uses a realistic cockpit setting to teach leadership skills. The customized, four-hour workshop draws on decades of experience from Captain Michael Caston, a pilot with experience flying Boeing 747 and 737 jets for British Airways and Singapore Airlines.

item.title: The first Founders' Friday session in Singapore by Huawei will showcase Scott Bales
item.description: Source: Scott Bales website. Huawei is launching a new networking series called Founders’ Friday. The series aims to connect business leaders with professionals to exchange ideas, address difficulties, and develop innovative solutions for advancing the digital world. The inaugural event, presented alongside the HUAWEI Mate 9, features prominent digital and innovation expert Scott Bales. He will discuss essential principles for fostering a culture of innovation within organizations. Bales, the Managing Director of Singapore-based Innovation Labs Asia, brings over a decade of global experience in innovation, thought leadership, implementation planning, and strategy.

item.title: The 2015 Budget of Singapore provides support for businesses
item.description: Source: Ministry of Finance, Singapore. Infrastructure investments were also announced as part of Budget 2015. Singapore’s Budget 2015, presented by Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam, included several business initiatives. These encompassed increased training assistance, a gradual reduction in business restructuring aid, a freeze on foreign worker levies (excluding manufacturing and construction), and measures to encourage innovation and expansion. Training and development Shanmugaratnam emphasized the government’s commitment to continuous investment in Singaporeans’ skills development.

item.title: The IPO activity in Singapore is expected to exceed that of 2016 in 2017
item.description: During the first half of 2017, Singapore saw a surge in initial public offerings (IPOs), attracting US$329 million in investments, as reported by PwC Singapore. This momentum is projected to continue, potentially exceeding the total funds raised in 2016. Professional services are emerging as a leading sector, with HRnetGroup and Shopper360’s IPOs securing a combined US$134 million, a significant leap from the previous year. While Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) and business trusts, a traditional strength for the Singapore Exchange (SGX), constituted 33% of IPO proceeds, the anticipated listing of NetLink Trust, estimated at US$1.

item.title: Tokio Marine Life Insurance Singapore enhances chatbot with recruitment features
item.description: Source: TMLS website. The TOMI avatar. Tokio Marine Life Insurance Singapore (TMLS), the only Japanese life insurer in Singapore, has introduced a recruitment feature to its chatbot, TOMI (Tokio Marine Insurance). This addition makes TOMI the first chatbot in Singapore to assist an insurer’s recruitment process, further enhancing its role as Singapore’s first self-learning AI chatbot designed to increase public access to life insurance. With the goal of engaging today’s tech-savvy generation in the recruitment process, TOMI is now equipped to answer over 300 questions about becoming a financial advisor.

item.title: Velox Networks claims that it can offer B2B phone services at a 95% lower cost
item.description: Velox Networks, a new telecommunications company in Singapore, offers a voice over internet protocol (VoIP) and cloud-based private branch exchange (PBX) communications platform. They claim their service could save businesses up to 95% compared to traditional major telcos. Currently, Singaporean businesses primarily use traditional PBXs for business-to-business communication. Velox aims to change this with its affordable, cloud-based PBX solution that surpasses the quality of free VoIP services, which often rely on less dependable consumer-grade technology.

item.title: Artyzen Singapore will be launched in October
item.description: Preferred Hotels & Resorts, boasting a global network of over 650 hotels, resorts, and residences in 80 countries, is expanding its presence in the Asia Pacific region with the upcoming October debut of Artyzen Singapore. This 20-story establishment occupies the former site of the Marie Villa mansion, conveniently situated near Orchard Road and the Singapore Botanic Gardens. The hotel features 142 generously sized rooms and suites, each spanning at least 42 square meters and offering either a balcony or terraced Sky Gardens.

item.title: CASIO introduces new watches to coincide with the 40th anniversary of G-SHOCK and the opening of its flagship store in Singapore
item.description: Source: CASIO. The new flagship store at ION Orchard mall in Singapore. CASIO has established its latest flagship store in Singapore’s ION Orchard mall. This store showcases a distinctive sculpture by Singaporean artist Jahan Loh. This artwork features a metallic half-body bust that evokes a futuristic cyborg, with the face being a representation of Casio’s iconic watch and its signature rounded rectangular bezel. Coinciding with the store launch, G-SHOCK, a Casio brand, has unveiled its most recent addition to the G-SQUAD sports series.

item.title: Coursera unveils the top courses for learners in Singapore in 2021
item.description: In 2021, Singaporean users on Coursera showed a strong interest in courses teaching in-demand tech and data science skills. This conclusion comes from Coursera’s yearly report analyzing course selections made by over 750,000 registered learners in Singapore. The report reveals the skills, abilities, and subjects most sought after by Singaporeans. Here are the top 10 most popular Coursera courses in Singapore for 2021: S Course Name Partner Name 1 First Step Korean Yonsei University 2 Machine Learning Stanford University 3 The Science of Well-Being Yale University 4 Foundations: Data, Data, Everywhere Google 5 Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python) University of Michigan 6 Financial Markets Yale University 7 Introduction to Psychology Yale University 8 _ Chinese for Beginners_ Peking University 9 _ Foundations of Project Management_ Google 10 Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects Deep Teaching Solutions Source: Coursera.

item.title: SilkAir will begin flying between Okinawa and Japan in January 2015
item.description: SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, will launch its inaugural charter flights between Singapore and Okinawa, Japan. Operated in partnership with Okinawa Tourist Service (OTS) and Jumbo Tours Okinawa, these monthly charters will run from September 9, 2014, to January 3, 2015. Utilizing Boeing 737-800 aircraft with both business and economy class seating, these direct flights aim to provide travelers with a convenient option to visit Okinawa. From September to October 2014, flights will depart Singapore Changi Airport Terminal 2 at 10:00 am and arrive at Okinawa Naha Airport at 4:15 pm.

item.title: Accor plans to introduce the ibis Styles brand to Singapore later this year
item.description: Source: Accor. The ibis Style in the Macpherson area, Singapore, will be launched this year. Accor plans to open an ibis Styles hotel in Singapore by the last quarter of 2015, introducing a trendy, lifestyle-focused brand to the country. Situated within the same complex as the MacPherson shopping mall, the hotel is conveniently located at the intersection of MacPherson and Aljunied Roads, a short 20-minute drive from the airport.

item.title: The groundbreaking ceremony for Jewel has been successfully completed
item.description: Source: Singapore Changi Airport. Jewel Changi Airport Trustee (JCAT), a collaboration between Changi Airport Group (CAG) and CapitaMalls Asia (the shopping mall branch of CapitaLand), has initiated the construction of Jewel Changi Airport. This mixed-use development, situated in front of Terminal 1 (T1), will feature attractions, retail spaces, a hotel, and airport operational facilities. Strategically placed at the airport’s core, Jewel aims to be a premier lifestyle destination enhancing Changi Airport’s global standing and solidifying Singapore’s attractiveness as a layover spot for travelers.

item.title: Singapore National Administrative Professionals Week is here. If you need someone to talk to, I'm here for you
item.description: A recent survey conducted by Zyllem, a delivery service, in honor of Singapore Administrative Professionals Day 2016, showed that 93% of respondents believe that Administrative Professionals are the unsung heroes of Singaporean businesses. However, the survey also revealed that 64% of coworkers admitted to taking their Admin Professionals for granted. They frequently rely on them to perform tasks outside their job description, including delivering umbrellas to colleagues stuck in the rain, sending forgotten passports to colleagues at airport check-in, performing first aid, and even providing early morning wake-up calls.

item.title: Job Forward introduces the Startup Essence referral tool for startups and small to medium enterprises (SMEs)
item.description: Source: Job Forward. Job Forward, the first online social recruitment platform in Singapore, has introduced Startup Essence. This new addition to their referral-based platform helps startups and small to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) by allowing them to build recruitment pages that attract and engage potential employees. The company aims to create a new avenue for these businesses to connect with individuals who are a good fit for their company culture.

item.title: Guangzhou businesses enter into Letters of Intent with Singapore organizations
item.description: Source: Guangzhou Municipal Government. Cai. The city of Guangzhou held a promotional event in Singapore to explore collaboration and innovation between the two business hubs. Two agreements were reached: one between the Sino-Singapore International Joint Research Institute and Chinese Academy of Sciences Holdings Company, and another between Guangzhou Gas Group, Guangzhou Port Group, and the industrial group Royal Golden Eagle. Guangzhou’s Vice Mayor, Cai Chaolin, who also leads the Nansha District’s Communist Party and Development Zone, highlighted the shared attributes between Guangzhou and Singapore, such as their size, cultural similarities, and languages.

item.title: The Startup Capitals conference will begin on May 20th
item.description: Source: Startup Capitals’ website. Startup Capitals, a leading-edge conference inspired by the recent book of the same name by Singapore-based author and journalist Zafar Anjum, will be held on May 20th in Singapore at The POD, NLB, 100 Victoria Street. This one-day event, coinciding with the book’s official launch, will highlight the innovation and startup ecosystems of globally impactful cities. It will unite all facets of these ecosystems – entrepreneurs, business leaders, innovators, researchers, educators, government officials, and venture capitalists – under one roof.

item.title: Buffets for Iftar are available at 21 on Rajah
item.description: Source: 21 on Rajah. The buffet. If you’re searching for a venue to hold a corporate Iftar gathering in Singapore during Ramadan, consider the halal-certified 21 On Rajah. Situated within Days Hotel Singapore at Zhongshan Park, this all-day dining restaurant is presenting a selection of Mediterranean and Asian Iftar buffets each evening. Chef de Cuisine Faustino Picardo Ines Jr and his culinary team have crafted diverse menus throughout the week.

item.title: The True Colours Festival showcases performances by exceptionally talented artists with disabilities
item.description: The True Colours Festival, showcasing talented performing artists with disabilities from the Asia Pacific region, will run from March 22nd to 25th, 2018 in Singapore. The festival will feature up to 20 artist/troupe performances representing Japan, China, India, Korea, Malaysia, Cambodia, Kazakhstan, New Zealand, Australia, and Singapore. Guest artists from the UK and Canada will also be featured. Performances will take place at a multimedia concert experience inside the Singapore Indoor Stadium and at the nearby True Colours Festival Village.

item.title: Singaporean companies are prioritizing cloud technology to gain a competitive edge
item.description: Source: VMware infographic. VMware, a leading company in virtualization and cloud infrastructure, recently shared the results of their vForum Singapore Business Survey. The survey shows a positive attitude toward hybrid cloud solutions, which combine public cloud services with internal cloud technology, as a method of driving growth, efficiency, and innovation. Almost every business surveyed (90%) believes that the cloud can facilitate innovation, and nearly half (44%) prefer a hybrid cloud model for their IT infrastructure.

item.title: Singapore investors who are accredited can transition to digital investing with Jachin Capital
item.description: Jachin Capital, a Singapore-based independent fund manager, is now authorized to offer its digital investment platform, iAdvisor, to accredited investors in Singapore after receiving a Capital Markets Services Licence from the Monetary Authority of Singapore. The company specializes in providing investment management solutions, including discretionary and non-discretionary options, to accredited investors and private family offices throughout the Asia-Pacific region. Jachin Capital uses a transparent, rules-based approach to build and regularly rebalance investment portfolios around specific themes or ideas.

item.title: Spotify reveals its list of 25 talented individuals under the age of 25 in Singapore
item.description: Spotify has unveiled the top 25 most influential artists under 25 who are currently dominating the music scene in Singapore. Shawn Mendes, an 18-year-old singer-songwriter from Canada, takes the top spot. He boasts 25 million monthly listeners on Spotify and over 500 million streams for his hit song, “Stitches.” Following closely behind Mendes are Ariana Grande, Martin Garrix, Justin Bieber, and Alessia Cara. Popular artists Gentle Bones and Fifth Harmony are also included in the list.

item.title: Today marks the grand opening of Singapore's most Instagram-worthy nightclub
item.description: MARQUEE Singapore, a massive new nightclub, is launching at Marina Bay Sands on April 12, 2019. The opening weekend will feature world-renowned DJs Tiësto and Afrojack, with a special appearance by American rapper A$AP Rocky. The 8K screen serves as a backdrop for TAO’s co-founders Tepperberg (left) and Strauss (right). This marks the first expansion into Asia for MARQUEE, a brand with clubs in New York, Las Vegas, and Sydney. The Singapore location is also the 35th project for TAO Group, the nightlife and hospitality company partnering with Marina Bay Sands on this venture.

item.title: Aladdin Street strives to become one of the top 10 e-marketplaces worldwide
item.description: Source: Aladdin Group. A lion dance to welcome Aladdin Street Singapore. The Aladdin Group is launching Aladdin Street Singapore, an e-commerce platform serving both businesses and individual consumers. It will operate through two websites: a Singapore-specific site at www.aladdinstreet.com.sg, and an international platform at www.aladdinstreet.com. Both sites are expected to launch in the fourth quarter of 2016. Aladdinstreet’s goal is to be a reliable and secure online marketplace for merchants to sell and consumers to buy premium, halal products.

item.title: Business sentiment in Singapore for 2017 is characterized by caution
item.description: The Singapore government has released business sentiment data for 2017, covering both the manufacturing and retail sectors. In the manufacturing sector, a survey conducted by the Singapore Economic Development Board revealed that a weighted 76% of firms expect business conditions in the first half of 2017 to remain similar to the previous quarter. While 13% anticipate improvement, 11% foresee a decline. Overall, the net weighted balance sits at 2%, indicating a slightly positive outlook for the manufacturing sector in early 2017.

item.title: Singtel's Dash and UOB Asset Management have collaborated to provide a mobile robo-adviser that includes an ESG option
item.description: Source: Singtel. Poster for UOBAM Robo-Invest. Singtel has introduced a new digital advisor, developed by UOB Asset Management (UOBAM), on its Dash e-wallet platform. This launch expands Dash’s selection of financial services, which already encompasses payments, international money transfers, insurance, savings, and investments. UOBAM Robo-Invest is the first robo-advisor in Singapore available on a mobile wallet and stands out by offering sustainable investing options created by UOBAM specifically for Dash users.

item.title: Numerous innovations showcased at Food&HotelAsia 2018
item.description: Display at the Suntec venue. The Food&HotelAsia (FHA) and ProWine Asia (PWA) trade shows are predicted to draw tens of thousands of attendees during their joint four-day run in Singapore, from April 24th to 27th. This year marks the largest event yet. Visitors can explore exhibits from over 3,500 international food, beverage, and hospitality exhibitors throughout 120,000 sq m at FHA. In addition, PWA 2018 features 300 international wine and spirits exhibitors across 7,500 sq m.

item.title: Jane's Walk is back in Singapore for its fifth year
item.description: Source: Jane’s Walk Singapore Peatix website. Aerial view of Queenstown. Now in its fifth year, Jane’s Walk Singapore is hosting a weekend of free walking tours throughout the city. Inspired by urbanist, author, and activist Jane Jacobs, Jane’s Walk is a series of free, volunteer-led walking tours. Jacobs advocated for walkable, lively neighborhoods and encouraged community involvement in urban development. Her most renowned work, The Death and Life of Great American Cities, emphasizes the importance of observation, inquiry, and exploration in understanding cities.

item.title: The Women in Business Asia Pageant hosts a workshop on digital marketing
item.description: Source: Women in Business Asia Pageant Facebook page. To empower women entrepreneurs, the Women in Business Asia Pageant is holding a masterclass on digital marketing and social media strategies specifically for women in Singapore. The session, titled “Digital Marketing and Social Media Hacks for Women in Business,” will run for one hour and teach participants how to build an effective, business-oriented website designed to generate leads. Attendees will discover how to incorporate both original and curated content into their marketing plans.

item.title: Establish a system of experiences that fosters success
item.description: To stand out, be creative and build an engaging experience around your product or service that resonates with your target audience, attracting customers organically. This advice comes from Big Bird Creative Company (BBCC), a Taiwanese integrated media company renowned for its children’s content services, including education consulting, production and distribution, and brand development, both in Taiwan and internationally. Cathy Han, President of BBCC, shared several success stories during the Media Summit at the Asian Festival of Children’s Content 2014 in Singapore this past June.

item.title: Singaporean businesses looking to invest in China can gain a competitive advantage at the recently established Singapore Centre in Guangzhou
item.description: Source: Ascendas. Companies from Singapore expanding their business into China now have access to a centralized service platform with the recent launch of the Singapore Centre at the Sino-Singapore Guangzhou Knowledge City (SSGKC). Known as Singapore Centre @SSGKC (Singapore Centre), this resource hub is situated within Ascendas OneHub GKC, an all-inclusive business park located within the SSGKC. The Singapore Centre consolidates key agencies and resources from both China and Singapore to offer comprehensive assistance for Singaporean companies investing in China.

item.title: SilkAir expands its route network to include Laos
item.description: SilkAir, the regional subsidiary of Singapore Airlines, has started its first flights to Vientiane and Luang Prabang in Laos. This addition expands SilkAir’s network to 51 destinations across 14 countries. The inaugural flight left Singapore’s Changi Airport at 1:20 PM on October 31st and arrived at Vientiane’s Wattay International Airport at 3:15 PM. The same flight continued on to Luang Prabang International Airport at 4:05 PM, landing at 5:00 PM. The return flight from Luang Prabang departed at 5:50 PM and arrived back in Singapore at 10:05 PM (all times local).

item.title: Jane's Walk Singapore offers a blend of classic and innovative walking tours
item.description: Source: Jane’s Walk Peatix page. Jane’s Walk logo. The annual Jane’s Walk Singapore, a series of free walking tours led by community members, will take place from May 4th to 6th. Inspired by urbanist Jane Jacobs, these walks encourage participants to share local stories, discover the city, and connect with their neighbors. While many tours are already at capacity, new spots may open up, so interested individuals are encouraged to check back.

item.title: Dell presents key features for IT Show 2018
item.description: Dell is featuring special deals on select products at IT Show 2018, happening in Suntec Singapore now through March 18th. The XPS 13, available in a new rose gold color, starts at S$2,899. This 13" device is touted as the most powerful in its class and the smallest 13" available. It boasts an 8th Gen Intel Quad Core processor, a 4K Ultra HD InfinityEdge display, and introduces Dell Cinema, featuring CinemaColor, CinemaStream with wireless channels, and CinemaSound with Waves MaxxAudio Pro.

item.title: JeweLuxe Singapore introduces a unique luxury retail concept unlike any other
item.description: JeweLuxe Singapore, a curated showcase featuring design, craft, artistry, and innovation from around the world, will launch in Singapore this October at TENT@Ngee Ann City along Orchard Road. The exhibition, open to the public from October 6 to 15, 2017, will showcase items for collectors, connoisseurs, and enthusiasts across various luxury lifestyle segments, including jewelry, timepieces, vintage items, eyewear, fashion, art, and living. Supported by the Singapore Tourism Board’s Kickstart Fund, this first-of-its-kind exhibition combines offline and online concepts, featuring aspects of a retail exhibition and an e-commerce marketplace.

item.title: SingPass has simplified the 2FA verification process before the July deadline
item.description: Singapore’s Infocomm Development Authority (IDA) announced that users of the national digital identity system, SingPass, can now enable two-factor authentication (2FA) more easily. This security feature is mandatory for accessing certain online services. Without activating 2FA, users will lose access to important government e-services like tax filing with the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) and viewing Central Provident Fund (CPF) statements. Starting July 5, 2016, over 100 government e-services will require 2FA.

item.title: Singapore and Australia provide the fastest mobile data speeds
item.description: Source: Ericsson South East Asia and Oceania regional Ericsson Mobility Report. According to Ericsson, Singapore is the only Southeast Asian nation with mobile networks strong enough to consistently support high-bandwidth applications, like streaming video, on consumer devices. The November 2015 Ericsson South East Asia and Oceania regional Ericsson Mobility Report states that Singapore is also the region’s first and only country with a smartphone subscription rate exceeding 100%. Both Singapore and Australia can provide high-definition video streaming anywhere their mobile networks reach.

item.title: Singaporeans will receive increased support for SkillsFuture
item.description: Source: SkillsFuture Singapore. Minister Puthucheary watches on as Ng (left) and Kevin Wo, Country GM, Microsoft Singapore (right) sign the MoU. To better equip Singapore’s workforce and businesses for a digital-centric economy, SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) has launched new initiatives. These include a partnership with Microsoft and enhancements to the national SkillsFuture for Digital Workplace program. Dr. Janil Puthucheary, Singapore’s Senior Minister of State for the Ministry of Transport and Ministry of Communications and Information, announced these developments at the first SkillsFuture Festival X Smart Nation (SFFXSmart Nation) event.

item.title: Collagen, probiotics, and plant-based protein were popular subjects at Vitafoods Asia
The winners of Ascendas-Singbridge Her Startup 2016 in Singapore have been announced
item.description: Source: The Ascendas-Singbridge Group. From left: Ho Kheng Lian, Venture Partner, Vectr Ventures; Natalie Loh, Vice President of Products, Vanitee; Kuik Xiao Shi, Co-Founder, Vanitee; Pocket Sun, Founding Partner of SoGal Ventures; Adrianna Tan, Founder, Wobe; Virginia Tan, Co-founder and Managing Director of Lean In China; Adeline Quek, Head of Regional Business Development, Grabtaxi; Mrs Nina Yang, Chief Operating Officer of Singbridge. The Ascendas-Singbridge Group selected two startups from Singapore to compete in the finals of the Ascendas-Singbridge Her Startup 2016 competition.

item.title: SingPost releases stamps showcasing classic board games
item.description: Source: SingPost. The new traditional board games stamp issue. Singapore Post (SingPost) is releasing a new set of five square stamps on April 27th. Each stamp features a hand-drawn image of a traditional board game popular in Singapore during the 1970s and 80s: Chinese chess, the diamond game, aeroplane chess, snakes and ladders, and checkers. Chinese chess (1st local denomination) is a strategic board game for two players simulating a battle between two armies.

item.title: Eko Nugroho is currently showcasing his street art exhibition through digital prints produced by HP
item.description: This image, from HP Inc., showcases embroidered artwork by Indonesian artist Eko Nugroho. It features his signature masked characters and intricate designs reminiscent of Japanese woodcuts. HP Inc is the Innovation Sponsor for the “Art from the Streets” exhibition at the ArtScience Museum in Singapore. For the exhibition, HP created nine large-scale prints of significant artworks. They are also using their digital printing technology to showcase the work of Indonesian artist Eko Nugroho in fresh and unexpected ways, demonstrating that street art can be displayed anywhere and on any medium.

item.title: Blum & Co transforms the cheongsam into stylish workwear
item.description: Blum, a Singaporean fashion brand, has launched a new line of workwear inspired by the traditional cheongsam. Source: Blum & Co. Emerging in the 1920s as a symbol of women’s liberation, the cheongsam has undergone stylistic changes throughout the years. Originally a loose-fitting, full-sleeved dress, it evolved to feature a slimmer silhouette with shorter hemlines and a side slit. Despite being prohibited in mainland China following the communist revolution, the cheongsam remained popular in Hong Kong.

item.title: Singapore's food and beverage industry delves into creating value at a profound level
item.description: Lee’s presentation shared industry forecasts on the Asian food industry opportunity. Singapore’s food and beverage (F&B) sector is transitioning its focus from productivity to value creation. Led by the Singapore Manufacturing Federation (SMF) and International Enterprise Singapore (IE Singapore), the industry is undergoing a transformation as manufacturers prioritize innovation, expansion, and globalization. Lee says Singapore F&B manufacturers have much to offer the world. From April 12th to 15th, FoodAsia2016 will feature a variety of local companies with novel creations as part of the Singapore Pavilion spearheaded by SMF.

item.title: The winners of the FinTech Awards have been announced
item.description: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and The Association of Banks in Singapore (ABS) awarded S$1.2 million to 12 fintech companies at the FinTech Awards, held during the third annual Singapore FinTech Festival. This year’s winning solutions focused on financial inclusion and represented a broader range of ASEAN countries. These solutions addressed various business areas, including credit scoring, mobile security, anti-money laundering, and digital investment. Here are the 12 award recipients:

item.title: The exclusive offers available at the 26th edition of The PC Show
item.description: The PC Show, celebrating 26 years of IT and consumer electronics in Singapore, is back. Major brands like Best Denki, Canon, Courts, Creative, Dell, Epson, Harvey Norman, HP, Lenovo, M1, Newstead, Samsung, Seagate, Singtel, and Toshiba will offer exciting products, deals, and competitive prices. Gillian Loh, Project Manager at Lines Exposition and Management Services, highlighted that attendees often look for great deals and the latest technology at the show. Organizers aim to continually improve the visitor experience, and this year they are introducing dedicated zones for specific interests and providing online updates on deals and new products.

item.title: UOB discovers misunderstandings about financing options for small and medium businesses in Singapore
item.description: Source: UOB infographic. Statistics gathered from the Financing for Startups and Small Businesses Survey. A recent study by United Overseas Bank (UOB) revealed that a significant number of startups and small businesses in Singapore lack a comprehensive understanding of the alternative funding options available to them for early expansion. These businesses are also uncertain about how to effectively utilize options such as venture capital, venture debt, and debt and equity crowdfunding.

item.title: Carly users now have the ability to post on Carousell as well
item.description: Carousell, a popular online classifieds platform, has acquired Caarly, a Singapore-based startup, as part of its strategy to dominate the classifieds market. Caarly is a mobile-first tool designed to simplify inventory management for used car dealerships. Since launching in Singapore in 2014, Caarly has partnered with over 200 car dealerships, representing a large portion of the market in Singapore. Existing Caarly partners can continue managing their inventory on the Caarly platform and seamlessly cross-post their listings to the cars category on Carousell with just one click.

item.title: Small and medium-sized businesses in Singapore are increasingly transitioning to cloud services
item.description: Parallels, a company specializing in hosting and cloud services, has released an updated report on the Singaporean cloud market for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), called Parallels SMB Cloud Insights. This 2014 report predicts significant growth for the SMB cloud services market in Singapore, projecting it to reach S$916 million by 2017. This represents a strong three-year compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 21%. Source: Parallels. Zanni. John Zanni, Chief Marketing Officer for Service Providers at Parallels, observed that the Asia Pacific region is poised to outpace the rest of the world in cloud adoption due to its later start.

item.title: Red Letter Sale by KEEPERS to feature Singaporean designer brands
item.description: Singapore’s largest designer sale is back and bigger in 2019, featuring over 50 designers offering discounts up to 90%. The second annual KEEPERS Red Letter Sale will showcase a variety of brands, including accessory makers, publishers, home and décor companies, fashion and shoe brands, and even food and drink vendors to keep shoppers energized. Attendees can: Discover local stories at Epigram Books Craft personalized scents with local perfumers Artisan of Sense, The LAB Fragrances, and SIX Explore environmentally friendly and natural skincare brands like Alcheme Skincare, offering free consultations for custom blends; Frank Skincare, a luxury brand handmade in Singapore; and RE:ERTH, featuring unique, naturally-derived ingredients like Japanese white turmeric.

item.title: The inaugural India-ASEAN Writers Festival premieres in Singapore
item.description: The High Commission of India in Singapore is hosting the first India-ASEAN Writers Festival in Singapore. This festival is one of many events celebrating 25 years of friendship between India and ASEAN, coinciding with the ASEAN India Pravasi Bharatiya Divas (Overseas Indians Day). The events are scheduled for January 6-7 at the Marina Bay Sands. The PBD Writers Festival, a key event organized by Singapore-based publishing house Kitaab International on behalf of the High Commission, aims to “celebrate the literary ties between India and the ASEAN nations,” said Zafar Anjum, Kitaab’s founder and CEO.

item.title: StarHub introduces WeChat SIM card for tourists from China visiting Singapore
item.description: StarHub has introduced two new prepaid SIM cards, named “StarHub WeChat Go SIM”, specifically designed for Chinese tourists visiting Singapore. This launch is a collaboration between StarHub and WeChat. The StarHub WeChat Go SIM aims to meet the connectivity needs of the increasing number of Chinese tourists. Data from the Singapore Tourism Board shows a 36% rise in tourists from China in 2016 compared to the previous year. A 2017 Hotels.

item.title: Singapore welcomes the arrival of Japanese fashion retail concepts
item.description: Source: WMH Group. Kafuku. World Mode Holdings Group (WMH Group) aims to improve the Singapore fashion retail sector by establishing its first international branch, iDA Singapore (iDA’SG). WMH Group is a Japanese fashion retail consultancy firm known for strengthening its clients’ brands. As Japan’s top recruiter for beauty and fashion sales professionals, their Singapore branch will offer expert guidance and support to enhance retail staff skills. “As Japan’s leader in retail job placements, we’ve placed 100,000 retail staff with approximately 1,000 clients, primarily in fashion and luxury.

item.title: The RYDE Carpool Challenge will begin in April
item.description: Singapore’s carpooling app, RYDE, has teamed up with Cycle & Carriage for the RYDE Carpool Challenge. The grand prize? A Mitsubishi Attrage. The eight-month campaign, which began on April 1, 2016, aims to have RYDE users complete a collective carpool distance of 1,000,000km, thus reducing carbon emissions by 200,000kg. By encouraging carpooling, RYDE hopes to promote a more environmentally friendly mode of transportation. Each month, RYDE will select two winners: the rider and driver with the highest number of successful carpools.

item.title: Register for a Jane's Walk (if possible)
item.description: ](https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjjjftL3eBnpoP9-lZPIx2FBUIjixQblEemCMYjK1fsqWMFAnV2mbG6iaAU305MtXqwpzxONmNTYc8Z02crj7dnUv-D5-CAAuQb0naLfJdJRIYhUsM2hARYEEShQ8L3TaCSNH0-kREbc6cU/s1600/20180505_150031.jpg) This image showcases an overseas Chinese support organization, 武裕平民互助会, with Lee Huat Motoring located just beyond the tree. As expected, spots for Jane’s Walks are quickly filling up. Jane’s Walk is a yearly event featuring free walks led by volunteers. These walks pay tribute to Jane Jacobs (May 4, 1916 - April 25, 2006), an urbanist, writer, and activist who tirelessly advocated for community involvement in urban design. This coming May marks the 7th anniversary of Jane’s Walk Singapore.

item.title: Enhance car safety with 360-degree hands-free device viewing
item.description: Sprint-Cass, the sole distributor of Taiwanese brand Digidock in Singapore, is introducing a new line of Digidock mobile device holders for vehicles at IT Show 2015, happening from March 19th to 22nd at the Suntec Convention Centre. These holders are designed for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. Every Digidock holder features a 360-degree swivel joint, allowing users to securely position their smartphones or tablets at any desired angle. Engineered for simple attachment and removal, the holders come with interchangeable cradles and universal mounts.

item.title: Exclusive benefits for Visa cardholders on their initial Deliveroo order
item.description: Visa and Deliveroo have teamed up to give Singaporean Visa cardholders special deals on their initial order until December 31, 2016. Ordering food will be easier, from browsing menus to paying with Visa. Tristan Torres, Deliveroo Singapore’s General Manager, highlighted this partnership as a significant step in their expansion within Singapore. He emphasized their dedication to providing top-notch service and convenience, including flexible payment options.
