Singapore leads the way in using cashless payments, such as Visa payWave, in-app transactions, and Visa Checkout.

item.title: StarHub introduces digital remittance services for Mobile Prepaid customers
item.description: StarHub Mobile Prepaid users can now send money internationally to over 40 countries within a day using the updated StarHub Prepaid app. This new feature is possible through a partnership with Singapore fintech company and licensed major payment institution, Pay2Home. Digital remittances through the app eliminate the need for physical queues or appointments. The StarHub Prepaid app allows users to conveniently manage everything from identity verification and checking updated currency rates to transferring funds and managing prepaid accounts.

item.title: Keppel Land enhances marketing strategy with virtual show suites
item.description: Keppel Land is the first developer in Singapore to utilize Oculus Rift technology to create 360-degree immersive virtual reality (VR) show suites for its Highline Residences property. These two digitally rendered suites complement the three existing physical show suites at the Highline Residences showroom in Singapore. The new VR platform, a collaboration between Keppel Land and visualisation firm VMW Group, features virtual tours of these new unit layouts. It also allows for a virtual exploration of key landmarks in the trendy Tiong Bahru neighborhood where Highline Residences is located.

item.title: Counterfeit software discovered in Singapore sold as authentic in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: This image depicts a counterfeit Certificate of Authenticity (COA). It only displays the product name and lacks any anti-counterfeiting measures. Microsoft recently uncovered a case of software piracy originating from a supplier in Singapore. The case involved an Australian reseller found to be in possession of fake COAs and other counterfeit software and hardware. COAs are labels or stickers affixed to the packaging of products like Windows, Office, and Windows Server.

item.title: In 2016, Dell EMC was recognized as one of the top companies to work for in Singapore
item.description: Dell EMC Singapore has been recognized as the 8th best company to work for in Singapore in 2016. This ranking comes from a comprehensive study conducted by the Great Place to Work Institute Singapore, which evaluates workplace culture. The study utilizes 58 metrics from employee surveys and company audits to measure the factors that contribute to a positive and successful work environment. Only organizations where a majority of employees consider it a great place to work are eligible for inclusion.

item.title: Singapore Airlines' Capital Express Service links Singapore, Canberra, and Wellington
item.description: Singapore Airlines is launching a new “Capital Express” route, connecting Singapore, Canberra, and Wellington. Starting on September 20, 2016, the airline will offer four weekly flights between these cities, subject to regulatory approval. The route will operate on a Singapore-Canberra-Wellington schedule for outbound flights and a Wellington-Canberra-Singapore schedule for return flights. The flights will utilize retrofitted Boeing 777-200 aircraft, configured with 38 Business Class seats and 228 Economy Class seats. This service marks a significant milestone as it will be Canberra’s first regularly scheduled international service and the first non-stop connection between the capitals of Australia and New Zealand.

item.title: The Palawan @ Sentosa provides eight lifestyle entertainment options
item.description: Shangri-La Group has introduced its first lifestyle and entertainment hub, spanning 183,000 square feet on Singapore’s Sentosa Island. This complex boasts eight unique experiences, including dining options. Chan Kong Leong, Regional CEO for the Shangri-La Group in Southeast Asia & Australasia, Hong Kong, Japan and Middle East, Europe, Indian Ocean & The Americas, emphasized the group’s commitment to providing enjoyable experiences and Asian hospitality. He stated that this venture aims to create excitement and bring more enjoyment to guests beyond their traditional hotel settings, allowing them to create their own memorable moments through diverse leisure and dining experiences.

item.title: Starbucks Singapore is launching a special, limited edition alice + olivia design collection
item.description: Starting January 31, 2015, Starbucks Singapore is offering a limited-edition collection of merchandise designed by Stacey Bendet, the CEO and Creative Director of alice + olivia. The collection incorporates the brand’s signature black-and-white color scheme and the famous ‘Stace Face’ logo, bringing a playful and whimsical touch to Starbucks merchandise. This special collection, which includes a ‘Stace Face’ mug, a reusable designer tote bag, and an alice + olivia Starbucks Rewards Card, is available at the Starbucks ION Orchard location.

item.title: Singaporean businesses are adapting to unprecedented circumstances
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic forced businesses to adapt in order to survive lockdowns. In Singapore, several companies found innovative ways to reinvent themselves: Audio House Audio House, a retailer known for selling electronics and appliances, typically relies on its physical showroom and in-person customer interactions. When Singapore’s lockdown restrictions forced the closure of their showroom, Audio House had to find new ways to operate. To retain their sales team and equip them with new skills, Audio House implemented an “Online Concierge” service.

item.title: West Air's inaugural international route links Chongqing with Singapore
item.description: Source: Changi Airport Group. A West Air aircraft. Changi Airport welcomed a new airline, West Air, which launched its first international route from Chongqing, China. West Air, headquartered in Chongqing, will fly between Singapore and the Western Chinese city three times a week. The airline will utilize an Airbus A320-200 with a capacity of 180 seats for this route. This new service marks West Air’s first venture into the international market and stems from a 2016 agreement to boost air travel between Singapore and Chongqing.

item.title: Singapore intensifies its response to COVID-19
item.description: Singapore’s Minister for National Development and Second Minister for Finance, Lawrence Wong, who also co-leads the task force for COVID-19, recently announced new measures to combat the country’s recent surge in cases, which jumped from 212 on March 14 to 385 by March 20. Wong stated that the government’s goal is to reduce social interactions and limit activities that could potentially spread the virus. He hopes these measures will result in fewer people in public spaces.

item.title: TripAdvisor has identified Tokyo, Singapore, and Dubai as some of the top choices in its Cities Survey
item.description: Singapore at night. The travel website TripAdvisor recently published its second annual Cities Survey, which collected data from over 54,000 user reviews. The survey evaluated cities worldwide based on traveler feedback. Tokyo received the highest ranking for providing the best overall travel experience. It also earned top scores for its helpful residents, taxi services, public transportation, and clean streets. Tokyo ranked among the top ten cities in 13 out of 16 survey categories.

item.title: The Durian Fiesta 2017 has been announced by Goodwood Park Hotel
item.description: Goodwood Park Hotel is hosting its yearly Durian Fiesta, featuring new creations and beloved classics that have delighted guests since 1983. From March 10th to July 31st, 2017, fourteen premium durian desserts, including six new additions, will be available, all crafted using the finest D24 and Mao Shan Wang durians. The featured desserts include the new D24 Starry Starry Night Ice Cream Cake, the D24 Sunflower Seed Crumble Tartlet, the D24 Cashew Nut Crumble Tartlet, the D24 Matcha Cake, and the D24 Salted Caramel Cuppa.

item.title: The DBS Marina Regatta is filled with exciting activities spread out over two weekends
item.description: Singapore’s largest water sports festival, the DBS Marina Regatta, returns for its fifth year with an expanded format spanning two weekends, May 28-29 and June 4-5. The event, which drew over 24,000 attendees last year, will feature regional dragon boat races set against the Marina Bay skyline, the return of Singapore’s only pop-up urban beach, and the debut of Southeast Asia’s tallest inflatable water slide. This year’s regatta will premiere several new features, including themed dragon boat races and competitive kayak races.

item.title: The 5th annual PCCW Global Charity Run will be held in Singapore this June
item.description: Source: PCCW Global Charity Run web page. A picture from the same event in 2017. The 5th yearly PCCW Global Charity Run will happen this June, and both PCCW employees and the general public can participate. This run is organized by PCCW Global, a telecommunications company operating in Asia, Africa, Latin America, and the Middle East. All funds raised from this year’s run will be donated to Make-A-Wish Singapore, an organization that grants wishes for children facing life-threatening illnesses.

item.title: Experience the flavors of an Italian Christmas at Casa Ferrero in Singapore
item.description: This year, Ferrero, the maker of Ferrero Rocher chocolates, has brought a touch of Italian Christmas magic to Singapore. Casa Ferrero, their only Southeast Asian pop-up shop, exudes elegance. The shop’s design echoes the gold of the classic Ferrero Rocher praline, enhanced by sparkling crystal chandeliers, the inviting aroma of espresso, and the distinct essence of roasted hazelnuts. Located outside the Wisma Atria mall along Orchard Road in Singapore, Casa Ferrero is even larger than last year’s pop-up, Pasticceria Ferrero.

item.title: Singapore residents are being targeted by a phone-based phishing campaign, according to DBS
item.description: DBS Bank has issued a warning to residents of Singapore about a phishing scam making use of automated phone calls. Given their customer base of over 4 million in Singapore alone, it is highly likely that scammers will connect with a DBS account holder. The scam, as reported on the DBS website, begins with an automated voice message in either English or Mandarin. The recipient is told they have an urgent message from DBS Bank and instructed to press either “0” or “1”.

item.title: Changi Airport consolidates early check-in services
item.description: Source: Changi Airport Group. Travelers departing from Singapore have increased access to early check-in services for various airlines at Changi Airport. Since the beginning of the year, shared early check-in counters have been established in Terminals 2 and 3. Terminal 1 features a dedicated early check-in lounge for added convenience. Operational from 6 am to midnight, the counters and lounge offer a centralized service point for passengers flying with 23 participating airlines.

item.title: Accenture demonstrates a potential vision of the future of retail in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: A recent report from Accenture, “The future is now: understanding the new Asian consumer,” highlights that consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies need to embrace digital commerce fully or face being overtaken by newer players in the rapidly growing Asia Pacific market. This market is expected to grow by US$340 billion by 2020, with China leading the way. Accenture emphasizes that CPG companies must adapt to a new generation of consumers who prefer digital engagement and trust social influence.

item.title: Seminar on Intellectual Property and Legal Issues by the RHT Academy
item.description: RHT Academy and RHTLaw Taylor Wessing are holding a half-day seminar titled “Commercial Contracts: Latest Case Law Developments, Negotiation Strategies and Intellectual Property” on March 4, 2015, at the Suntec Convention & Exhibition Centre in Singapore. Designed for legal professionals, business development executives, company secretaries, and compliance officers, this seminar aims to: Offer a practical, business-focused overview of recent key case law developments related to commercial contracts in Singapore and the UK.

item.title: Supporting mothers returning to work and mom entrepreneurs in advancing their careers
item.description: For more details, scan the QR code. Among the nearly 40,000 members of Mums@Work, common challenges faced when rejoining the workforce include age, keeping up with technology and necessary skills, a lack of confidence, anxieties about new work environments, and generational differences. This is despite over 80% of members having more than eight years of professional experience, primarily in white-collar roles within banking and finance, media and entertainment, and human resources.

item.title: The HUAWEI Mate 10 Pro was first launched in Singapore, making it the first country in the world to introduce the device
item.description: Huawei recently launched its Mate 10 Series smartphones, including the Mate 10, Mate 10 Pro, and PORSCHE DESIGN Mate 10, in Singapore. The launch makes Singapore the first country globally to have the Mate 10 Pro available for purchase. A key feature of these phones is the Kirin 970 AI chipset, which significantly boosts system response speed and ensures smoother performance. According to Cheng Jiangfei, Country Head of Huawei Singapore, Consumer Business Group, the company is committed to providing Singaporean customers with the latest and greatest technology.

item.title: Song Seung Heon is in Singapore to promote Saimdang
item.description: Source: Singtel. Korean celebrity Song Seung Heon spent time with fans and Singtel TV subscribers during a Singapore trip sponsored by Singtel and Oh!K. Two hundred Singtel TV subscribers in Singapore enjoyed an exclusive meeting with Korean actor Song Seung Heon, hosted by Singtel and Oh!K. Song’s visit was to promote his K-drama Saimdang (师任堂). Before a large public event at The Cathay, Singtel TV subscribers could take pictures with Song and chat with him.

item.title: Dermatologists have created a one-of-a-kind hand sanitizer
item.description: ● Developed by dermatologists with a deep understanding of skin care and patient requirements. ● Eliminates 99.99% of common household germs and viruses, including SARS-COV-2, upon application. ● Remains effective for 24 hours, even after handwashing, minimizing the need for frequent reapplication. DS Skin Clinic and its global network of clinics have introduced the DS Skin Clinic All-Day Hand Sanitizer. This innovative product is engineered to outperform existing hand sanitizers available in the market.

item.title: Glassdoor has released a list of the top 10 workplaces in Singapore
item.description: The job and recruiting website Glassdoor has revealed the winners of its annual Employees’ Choice Awards, which included a category for Singapore for the first time. These awards recognize the Best Places to Work in 2020 across nine countries, including Singapore. The rankings are determined by the input of employees who anonymously share their experiences through company reviews on Glassdoor. This feedback encompasses their job, work environment, and employer over the past year.

item.title: Collective Works and CapitaLand are teaming up to launch a new coworking space
item.description: Artist’s impression of the new coworking space at Capital Tower, Singapore. A new high-end coworking space will be launched on the 12th floor of Singapore’s Capital Tower. This joint venture between two companies will occupy 22,000 square feet and support 250 businesses. The space is adaptable and caters to a variety of businesses, from new startups to large corporations. Technological features include secure server hosting, video conferencing, internet phone services, and fiber optic broadband internet.

item.title: Singtel introduces a new prepaid SIM card that also functions as a travel card
item.description: Singtel has introduced the hi!Tourist EZ-Link SIM card, a first in Asia, which combines a prepaid SIM card with a stored value travel card usable for Singapore’s public transportation. Source: Singtel. The hi!Tourist EZ-Link SIM card is the first in Asia to combine travel and phone services. Priced at S$18, this SIM card provides 100 GB of 4G data, unlimited access to social media and messaging apps, and 1 GB of roaming data for select countries in the region.

item.title: Caffè Vergnano 1882 has chosen the top three baristas in Singapore
item.description: Source: Caffè Vergnano 1882. From left: third place winner Rudel Rivera, first place winner Joseph Bringcula, and second placer Stephen Wong. Caffè Vergnano 1882 held its first-ever Barista Challenge at South Beach. Out of 16 participants, three distinguished themselves as top contenders. Source: Caffè Vergnano 1882. The winning latte art from Bringcula. The competition assessed fundamental barista techniques, including the ability to brew espresso properly and steam milk to enhance its flavor.

item.title: Spotify reveals top music of 2014
item.description: Source: Spotify. Spotify has unveiled its Year in Music, analyzing data from 50 million users and over 7 billion hours of music to determine 2014’s top songs and artists. UK artist Ed Sheeran leads as the most streamed artist globally, with over 860 million streams on Spotify. His album, released in June to critical acclaim, also achieved the highest number of streams, exceeding 430 million. In Singapore, Jay Chou maintains his position as the most streamed Asian artist for the second consecutive year.

item.title: Men's Chorus debuts virtual choir performance
item.description: Sing! Men’s Chorus (SMC), an all-male choir in Singapore, has launched its first virtual choir project, “Why We Sing,” marking the return of arts performances in the country. The music video, available on SMC’s YouTube channel, was created over two months and conveys a message of hope: that the arts community can adapt to a new normal where the arts, especially music, are recognized for their essential role in community development.

item.title: Happn shows that the east is the ideal location for social gatherings
item.description: Source: Happn. The top 10 Happn hotspots. For those seeking romantic connections in Singapore, heading east might be the key. Happn, a dating app that connects individuals who have crossed paths, has identified the top ten locations in Singapore where users are most likely to find potential matches. With a presence in over 40 major cities globally, including Hong Kong, Happn boasts more than 22.5 million users. The app utilizes real-time geolocation technology to show users individuals they’ve been near, within a 250-meter radius.

item.title: Singtel provides an explanation of mobile performance
item.description: Singtel contributed to the Infocomm Development Authority’s (IDA) MyConnection SG study, highlighting connectivity, speed, and coverage as crucial aspects of user experience. Singtel emphasized that, based on study feedback, users prioritize network coverage, call stability, customer service, and reliable data connections over pure speed. Consistent speed across a broad coverage area is key for a positive user experience. This feedback helps Singtel pinpoint areas for service enhancement. Connectivity, as defined by Singtel, is the server connection response time, measured in milliseconds.

item.title: Canon Singapore will be hosting the Photo Marathon again in August 2015
item.description: Source: Canon eDM. Canon Singapore has announced the details for their 13th annual Photo Marathon, taking place on August 22nd from 7 am to 8 pm at the Marina Bay Sands Expo and Convention Centre, Level 1, Hall C. The competition revolves around three photography themes that are revealed on the day of the event. Participants are tasked with capturing these themes in their photographs and submitting them by the given deadline.

item.title: A new tech and innovation business club has been introduced in Singapore
item.description: SPECTRUM, a curated tech and innovation business club, has been established in Singapore. The organization, co-founded by Cheryl Lee and Shirley Crystal Chua, aims to create a globally connected ecosystem for businesses seeking to expand into Asia by providing expert advice, necessary resources, and strategic networks. SPECTRUM has partnered with Golden Equator and Mistletoe to form a collaborative network of seven strategic groups: innovators, learning institutions, executors, backers, enablers, government agencies, and ecosystem builders and partners.

item.title: Rasel offers artisanal catering services
item.description: Rasel Catering Singapore, a top-tier halal catering service, has enhanced its offerings to become a leader in the industry. Alan Tan, Co-Founder and Managing Director of Rasel Catering Singapore, highlighted the company’s focus on meeting the evolving needs of a global clientele. He stated, “Rasel caters to international events and weddings, recognizing the sophisticated tastes of today’s customers and their demand for high-quality halal food. Our service goes beyond just the food itself—we leverage our expertise to elevate the entire experience for our customers.

item.title: Zap Delivery in Singapore guarantees fast and reliable couriered deliveries
item.description: Source: Zap Delivery. Zap Delivery, an on-demand courier service, promises quick, safe, and dependable deliveries of packages and documents within Singapore in two hours or less using their new mobile app. This app utilizes advanced authentication and real-time tracking to provide peace of mind for those awaiting deliveries. “We’ve experienced our fair share of delivery issues, so we created a user-friendly app that fosters trust," explained Michael Tan, Zap Delivery Co-founder and CEO.

item.title: Cafédirect introduces Cauca Terroir Roast & Ground Coffee in Singapore
item.description: According to Cafédirect, their Cauca Terroir Roast & Ground Coffee pairs well with sweet and fruity flavors. Ideal pairings in Colombia include pan de queso (cheese bread) and alfajores (caramel cookie sandwiches). “Terroir” encapsulates the unique environmental and geographic factors of a region that influence a beverage’s taste. Cafédirect recently introduced their Cauca Terroir Roast & Ground Coffee to Singapore. Colombians describe this high-altitude coffee as “black as night, hot as hell and sweet as love”.

item.title: Escaping from the Asian Civilisations Museum: A Great Adventure
item.description: Singapore’s Asian Civilisations Museum is hosting “Night at the Museum: The Great Escape from Asian Civilisations Museum,” featuring two evenings of movies and interactive games. This event, possibly the first of its kind globally, is designed as a museum-wide escape room. Participants will solve puzzles, uncover museum secrets, and decipher the meanings behind ancient artifacts to “escape.” Winners have a chance to win movie tickets to Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb.

item.title: The new snowskin flavors at Goodwood Park are ideal combinations
item.description: Goodwood Park Hotel is celebrating the Mid-Autumn Festival with new snowskin mooncake flavors that perfectly pair two complementary ingredients. This year, the hotel is even introducing its first-ever chocolate mooncake. One of the new additions is the Yuzu Lychee Snowskin Mooncake, featuring the bright citrus flavor of yuzu combined with sweet lychee pieces. Another highlight is the limited-edition Dark Chocolate Crunchy Hazelnut Snowskin Mooncake. This decadent treat consists of a crunchy hazelnut chocolate center surrounded by rich dark chocolate mousse, all encased in a snowskin made with crushed vanilla beans and caramel.

item.title: Brand Alliance reveals the top influential brands in Asia for 2015
item.description: Source: Brand Alliance. The brand gallery at Marina Bay Sands is open until August 21st. Brand Alliance, using its brand leadership platform Influential Brands, has announced the 2015 Asia’s Top Influential Brands. This announcement leverages consumer insights gathered from 2013 to 2015. This year, the Asia’s Top Influential Brands awards expanded to include over 100 categories. These categories span various sectors, ranging from food and beverage (F&B) and fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) to financial services and property development.

item.title: Goodwood Park Hotel launches a new promotion featuring white asparagus
item.description: An image showcasing white asparagus from the Goodwood Park Hotel website. Throughout May, indulge in the sweetness and succulence of imported German white asparagus at two distinct dining destinations: Gordon Grill, the renowned Continental fine-dining restaurant at Goodwood Park Hotel, and Min Jiang at One-North, a modern Chinese establishment in a restored colonial bungalow at Rochester Park. Established in 1963, Gordon Grill at the Goodwood Park Hotel has earned a stellar reputation for its exceptional steaks and Continental cuisine.

item.title: Experience cutting-edge VR gaming at Bugis Junction and Bugis+, Singapore
item.description: This Halloween, shoppers at Singapore’s Bugis Junction and Bugis+ malls can participate in an immersive virtual reality (VR) gaming experience. This event marks the first time malls in Singapore have hosted a VR experience of this magnitude. The “Time Zombies” competition invites shoppers to assume the roles of time-traveling detectives. Their mission: to stop the nefarious Dr. Virago, a mad scientist attempting to unleash a zombie apocalypse. This competition utilizes cutting-edge Arctic Fox wireless technology, allowing players to move freely within the virtual world using a wireless headset, eliminating the need for cumbersome cables or backpack computers.

item.title: Reserve a spot for a handicraft workshop at the Etsy Craft Party 2016 - Summer Edition
item.description: Individuals with a creative spirit or those seeking engaging team-building exercises might be interested in three craft workshops featured at the “Etsy Craft Party 2016 - The Summer Edition” on June 18, 2016. The Singapore edition of this annual Etsy event is organized by Crafty Singapore, with support from Etsy. Source: Crafty Singapore. Finished embroidery on tiny ‘mini’ embroidery hoops. Needlework on a Miniature Hoop Presented by Wish I Were Stitching (two sessions, eight participants per session)

item.title: Epson introduces a small, portable printer for mobile use
item.description: Source: Epson. The WF-100 is designed for professionals on-the-go. Epson, a company that provides digital imaging and printing solutions, has introduced the Epson WorkForce WF-100. This printer is one of the smallest and lightest mobile printers globally. Its compact design caters to professionals who are frequently on the move. It features a built-in battery that can be recharged via USB and integrated wireless capabilities for easy printing while traveling.

item.title: Singtel collaborates with Singapore polytechnics on initiatives for small and medium enterprises (SMEs)
item.description: Singtel is partnering with Nanyang Polytechnic (NYP) and Singapore Polytechnic (SP) to equip small and medium enterprises (SMEs) with digital skills, as part of the 99% SME initiative. This partnership aims to help SMEs in the retail and food and beverage industries thrive in the digital world. The collaboration with NYP’s Singapore Institute of Retail Studies (SIRS) will connect SMEs with re-skilled professionals who can guide them in e-commerce, data analysis, and digital marketing strategies.

item.title: Promotions for Dell at CEE 2017
item.description: Dell is promoting several products at the Consumer Electronics Exhibition (CEE) 2017. These products, equipped with 7th Gen Intel Core processors, are designed for an excellent visual experience and enhanced gameplay. Here are some of the featured products: Inspiron 13 5000 2-in-1 Original Price: Starting from S$1,699 Show Price: Starting from S$1,299 Features: Latest 7th Gen Intel Core processor 13.3" FHD (1,920 x 1,080) IPS Truelife LED-backlit touchscreen with wide viewing angles and an infrared (IR) camera Four versatile modes: tent, stand, laptop, and tablet XPS 13 2-in-1

item.title: The Someline Apple Tree app will produce apples for charity as long as you refrain from using your phone
item.description: Source: Google Play. Libern Lin, a student entrepreneur attending Republic Polytechnic in Singapore, has expanded his app, Someline Apple Tree, with financial support from the Singapore Computer Society (SCS). The app incentivizes real-life interactions by rewarding users with digital apples for reducing phone usage. Lin, the app’s creator, explained that they wanted to use the app’s concept for a good cause. So, they used the S$30,000 grant from SCS to add a charitable component to the app in line with IDA’s Code for Charity*.

item.title: Learn the fundamentals of blockchain technology at Smartcademy
item.description: Source: Unsplash, via Smartcademy. This image illustrates Blockchain technology, with cryptocurrency being one example of its use. [ Smartcademy, a Singaporean organization focused on technology education and career development, has launched a beginner-friendly introductory course on Blockchain. This one-month program covers basic concepts and terminology, explores how Blockchain is used in finance, and explains the workings of Bitcoin. The course aims to equip individuals with the knowledge to navigate the risks and rewards of digital financial systems.

item.title: Just under half of Singaporeans believe that Budget 2016 is fair
item.description: A recent poll of 986 Singaporeans by YouGov, a global polling and research company, revealed widespread pessimism regarding the future despite a generally neutral sentiment about the 2016 Budget. While over a quarter of respondents viewed the current economy positively, a significant majority (over 60%) believed it was either declining or stagnant. This negative outlook was particularly pronounced among older respondents (aged 45-54). Although half of those surveyed considered the 2016 Budget fair, a significant majority (60%) did not believe it would significantly impact their lives over the next year.

item.title: Singaporean businesses are feeling more optimistic than those in Hong Kong and are enjoying a superior work-life balance
item.description: While 43% of businesses in Singapore are very confident about their growth prospects this year, only 30% of businesses in Hong Kong share the same level of confidence. This year, 61% of businesses in Singapore have plans to increase their workforce, whereas only 44% in Hong Kong intend to do so. A recent report called the Compass Index, which analyzed business trends in Hong Kong and Singapore, reveals a more optimistic outlook among businesses in Singapore, with employees experiencing a better work-life balance than their counterparts in Hong Kong.

item.title: Experience the street food of Taiwan at Tea Valley
item.description: Tea Valley: Bringing Taiwan’s Street Food Flavors to Singapore [Image of Tea Valley Downtown East outlet] Tea Valley (茶食坊), a casual Taiwanese dining chain in Singapore, has ambitious plans for expansion. At a tasting event held at their first location in Downtown East, Director Lawrence Lim shared his vision for growing the brand beyond just new locations, but also in the variety of services they offer. [Image of Lawrence Lim, Director of Tea Valley]

item.title: The IDA in Singapore has compiled a report on home computer usage in Singapore for the year 2014
item.description: A 2014 survey by the Infocomm Development Authority (IDA) of Singapore revealed a surge in smartphone, computer, and internet use among Singaporean seniors. The study, titled Annual Survey on Infocomm Usage in Households, found that 74% of Singaporean residents used a computer in the three months leading up to the survey. Senior citizens aged 50 and above showed the most significant increase in computer usage. Between 2012 and 2014, computer use among seniors aged 50 to 59 grew by 14 percentage points, while those over 60 showed an 11 percentage-point increase.

item.title: Collective Works, a coworking space located in the business district of Singapore, has been officially launched
item.description: A typical co-working space at Collective Works Capital Tower. Collective Works, the first coworking space in Singapore’s central business district, has partnered with CapitaLand to open its second location. This 22,000 square foot “office of the future,” designed for high performance, takes up the entirety of the 12th floor in the 52-story Capital Tower situated in Tanjong Pagar. Collective Works has built a reputation for its stylish design and meticulous attention to detail, including a focus on ergonomics, ambiance, lighting, and acoustic sound.

item.title: BCM Institute offers Business Continuity Management courses specifically designed for small and medium-sized enterprises in Singapore
item.description: The BCM Institute, in collaboration with the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC), is offering a free two-day Business Continuity Management (BCM) course designed to enhance the resilience of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) against disruptions. Taking place on October 28-29, 2014, at the Singapore Productivity Centre, this course is presented with support from the Singapore Business Federation and SPRING Singapore. Participants will engage with the following topics: APEC-endorsed step-by-step BCM implementation guidelines Complimentary, ready-to-use BCM templates Guidance on utilizing BCM templates Insights into BCM trends affecting SMEs, shared by an APEC ASEAN BCM Working Group Committee member SMEs meeting the criteria of an annual sales turnover not exceeding S$100 million or employing 200 or fewer staff are eligible to participate.

item.title: Passengers from China can use Alipay to pay for Grab rides in Singapore and Thailand
item.description: Chinese visitors to Singapore and Thailand can now use Alipay to pay for Grab rides thanks to a new partnership between Grab, Southeast Asia’s ride-hailing leader, and Ant Financial Services Group, the force behind China’s largest third-party payment platform, Alipay. This collaboration offers a cross-border payment solution, allowing Alipay users to pay for Grab taxis and private cars directly through their Alipay accounts. Previously, Chinese travelers had limited payment choices, relying on dual-currency credit cards or cash for Grab rides.

item.title: Adidas introduces the Superstar 80s Pioneers Pack in Singapore
item.description: Source: adidas. Drawing on Superstar 80s by Gonz. Adidas recently released the Superstar 80s Pioneers Pack, a collaboration with skateboarder Mark Gonzales, known as Gonz, and designer NIGO. Gonz, a renowned innovator and rule-breaker, changed skateboarding for a whole generation. His drive to create inspired the Superstar 80s by Gonz. The shoe’s all-white leather upper serves as a blank slate, inviting wearers to personalize their sneakers using the included markers.

item.title: InterContinental Hotels & Resorts presents an art installation in Singapore to commemorate its 200 properties worldwide
item.description: Video of Hall with the bottles shaping the number ‘200’. To mark the opening of their 200th hotel, InterContinental Hotels & Resorts commissioned contemporary British artist Alexander Hall, known professionally as Haut de Gamme, to create a commemorative installation. The artwork features 200 champagne bottles, each hand-painted by Hall in his signature drip technique. Inspired by the unique character of each InterContinental property, the individually designed bottles collectively form the number “200”.

item.title: Herbalife has found that women in Singapore who work are less active than men
item.description: Herbalife, a worldwide nutrition company, has found some differences in the health outlooks and routines of working men and women in Singapore. Their Nutrition at Work survey showed that, compared to men, women in Singapore tend to stay at their desks longer, eat lunch at their desks more, and have more difficulty being active during a typical workday. “Our aim as a global nutrition company is to provide members and customers with high-quality nutrition products that support healthy eating and active lifestyles,” said Dr.

item.title: The commercial property forecast for Q4 2014 is at its lowest in Hong Kong
item.description: Singapore Marina Bay business district at night. The Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) Global Commercial Property Monitor for the fourth quarter of 2014 suggests that while economic indicators show a decline in the Hong Kong economy, growth is expected to rise steadily this year. In Hong Kong, the RICS Occupier Sentiment Index (OSI) decreased slightly from +4 to -3 during the last quarter. The RICS Investment Sentiment Index (ISI) remained negative at -3.

item.title: Bakerzin introduces seven new mooncake collections for 2017
item.description: Bakerzin has introduced its Creme de la Creme mooncake assortment, featuring handcrafted mooncakes made with low-sugar white lotus paste. The collection includes seven distinct lines, available in both traditional baked and snow skin varieties. [Image of Bakerzin’s 2017 mooncake collection] Source: Bakerzin Facebook page. Bakerzin’s mooncake collection for 2017. The Bold Collection showcases baked mooncakes with unique flavors such as American ginseng, ginger, tom yam, and sakura ebi. The Signature Collection features the return of their popular premium egg yolk blend baked mooncake.

item.title: Singapore's Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) reveals initiatives to promote innovation in the industry
item.description: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) outlined its plans to support the digitalization recommendations put forth by the Committee on the Future Economy (CFE) to help prepare the financial sector for the future. MAS will facilitate infrastructure projects aimed at driving innovation, enhancing market efficiency, improving customer service, and strengthening Singapore’s regional connectivity. Key projects include: Electronic Marketplace for Trade Finance Assets An electronic trade finance platform will allow participating banks to distribute trade finance assets globally, free up capital for new trade finance loans, and increase the availability of trade finance within the region.

item.title: There is something for everyone on Jane's Walks
item.description: Source: Jane’s Walk Singapore page. Jane’s Walk, a global initiative of free walking tours led by community members, is making a comeback from May 6th to 8th. The walks are inspired by Jane Jacobs (1916-2006), an urban planner and advocate who championed community-driven city development. Grounded in the belief that everyone possesses knowledge about their surroundings, these walks celebrate Jacobs’ ideas worldwide. Participants share stories about their neighborhoods, discover hidden gems, and connect with their neighbors.

item.title: Initiating a discussion with real-time Tableau visualizations
item.description: David Murphy, Google’s Head of TV Attribution (APAC), illustrates the stark contrast between working with data “before Tableau” and “after Tableau.” He first encountered Tableau in 2010. In his presentation “Don’t Fear the Data” at the “Tableau on Tour” conference in Singapore, Murphy argues that large datasets become manageable with the right tools. He highlights how discovering Tableau’s visualization software revolutionized his work. Prior to Tableau, he relied on spreadsheets for chart creation, a process he dreaded altering.

item.title: ValueChampion warns that driving in Singapore is more perilous than you might realize
item.description: While Singapore boasts one of the world’s lowest road fatality rates per person, ValueChampion suggests that driving in Singapore might be riskier than in other developed nations. Anastassia Evlanova, a Senior Research Analyst at ValueChampion Singapore, highlights in a recent blog post (which builds on research from 2017) that Singapore recorded 12.13 deaths per 100,000 vehicles in 2019, surpassing rates in Japan and Australia. She explains, “Looking at road safety solely based on deaths per capita creates a deceptive view of driving safety in Singapore.

item.title: SilkAir will be operating SIA flights SQ466 and SQ467 to Colombo
item.description: Starting April 8, 2017, SilkAir, the regional branch of Singapore Airlines (SIA), will begin flights to Colombo, the commercial hub of Sri Lanka and a diverse city home to a large population. SilkAir will take over flights SQ466/SQ467, offering three weekly flights to Colombo. SIA will maintain its daily nighttime service, operating flights SQ468 and SQ469. Adding SilkAir to the Singapore-Colombo route allows the SIA Group to optimize resource allocation and better match capacity with demand.

item.title: DBS/POSB introduces Chinese New Year service offerings
item.description: To celebrate the Year of the Rabbit, DBS/POSB is expanding its blended digital and physical (“phygital”) Chinese New Year (CNY) gifting and rewards programs. This CNY, customers can take advantage of the following: Conveniently order DBS QR Gift cards (QR AngBaos) through the bank’s chatbot, digibot, and have them delivered before CNY. A chance to win a Tesla Model 3 and other rewards, including cash rebates, by switching to QR Gift and other DBS/POSB digital transactions.

item.title: Joo Chiat Kim Choo introduces halal rice dumplings at 7-Eleven Singapore
item.description: Source: Joo Chiat Kim Choo/7-Eleven. - Halal rice dumplings from Kim Choo Kid are now sold at all 7-Eleven stores in Singapore. - Customers can choose from two flavors: Nonya Chicken and Salted Chicken. For convenience, the leaves have been removed. Singapore’s 7-Eleven stores now offer a halal version of the famous Joo Chiat Kim Choo rice dumplings. Part of the Neo Group, this top rice dumpling maker in Singapore is known for its Nonya dumplings, made with a recipe handed down through generations.

item.title: GuocoLand will be responsible for overseeing the management of both Sofitel Singapore City Centre and Sofitel Kuala Lumpur Damansara
item.description: Source: AccorHotels. Tanjong Pagar Centre. GuocoLand will oversee the operation of two new AccorHotels establishments: the Sofitel Singapore City Centre at Tanjong Pagar Centre in Singapore and the Sofitel Kuala Lumpur Damansara in Damansara City, Kuala Lumpur. These additions contribute a total of 534 rooms to AccorHotel’s luxury brand. Raymond Choong, President and CEO of GuocoLand Group, expressed enthusiasm for the partnership with AccorHotels, highlighting the shared vision for creating modern, convenient spaces within bustling business districts.

item.title: The BNI business referral system has the potential to yield significant returns
item.description: Sukri Kadola, the founder and CEO of Singapore’s Bloem Singapore, a boutique and floral design house, has taken on a new role as President of the BNI Apex chapter. This chapter is part of the BNI business network, known for its referral system. Kadola highlights the success of this system, reporting that BNI Apex has closed approximately S$6 million in business since 2012 through referrals. Source: Bloem. Kadola. Kadola emphasizes the value of BNI’s network, stating that it provides a platform for members to connect, support each other, and generate business opportunities through referrals.

item.title: The True Colours Festival includes a number of groundbreaking inclusive initiatives
item.description: Source: True Colours Festival website. Some of the featured performers. This coming March, twenty artists and groups will come together in Singapore for the first and largest event in the Asia Pacific region to showcase performers with disabilities. From March 22-25, 2018, Singapore will host True Colours Festival – the Asia Pacific Celebration of Artistes with Disabilities. True Colours is presented by UNESCO and The Nippon Foundation (TNF), two global organizations that advocate for the rights of people with disabilities (PWDs).

item.title: Dell and Alienware are currently offering promotions at SITEX
item.description: Dell and Alienware are offering promotions on select products at SITEX 2016, taking place from November 26th to 27th at the Singapore Expo Halls 5 and 6. XPS 13 Laptop Known as the world’s smallest 13" laptop, the latest XPS prioritizes performance, portability, and impressive visuals. Its stand-out feature is the InfinityEdge display, which is practically borderless. This model boasts a powerful 7th Gen Intel Core i7 processor for enhanced performance and prolonged battery life.

item.title: Employers in Singapore are struggling with stress and mental health concerns
item.description: A large majority (72%) of Singaporean employers view stress and mental health as factors that negatively impact productivity, according to the APAC Benefits Strategy Study 2017 conducted by global professional services firm Aon. The International Labour Organization has labeled stress a “global epidemic” and “silent killer,” particularly within many Asian countries experiencing rapid economic growth and adopting Western lifestyles, including Singapore, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and mainland China. Early physical symptoms of stress can manifest as chronic back pain, fatigue, and headaches.

item.title: Exploring the history of Bukit Panjang, Singapore
item.description: Jane’s Walk, a global movement of free walking tours inspired by urbanist Jane Jacobs, continues to thrive in Singapore, with tours often fully booked within hours of being announced. This enthusiastic response highlights the movement’s ability to connect people with their communities and explore urban landscapes. This year, on May 5th, a sold-out walk titled “At the Crossroads: Bukit Panjang” offered participants a unique opportunity to delve into the neighborhood’s rich history.

item.title: New OCBC Securities app and Android OCBC app now offer fingerprint security
item.description: Source: OCBC. The iOCBC TradeMobile app allows users to perform in-depth technical analyses of stocks using standard indicators. OCBC Securities has introduced a new mobile app called iOCBC TradeMobile for iPhone users. Existing OCBC Securities customers can now conveniently monitor their stock portfolios and access real-time market data for their stocks using Apple’s Touch ID technology. This fingerprint authentication feature, known as OneTouch, offers both OCBC Bank and OCBC Securities customers a secure and convenient way to access their banking and brokerage accounts.

item.title: Bloem marks 4th anniversary with introduction of new services and partnerships
item.description: Pictured from left to right: Sukri Kadola and Ivy Tan cut a cake during Bloem’s anniversary celebration. Singapore’s custom floral design company, Bloem, recently commemorated its fourth anniversary. The company marked this occasion by announcing new partnerships and the launch of its Concierge service. “While many believe the economy has presented difficulties for businesses, success is subjective,” says Sukri Kadola, Bloem’s Founder and CEO. Eighty percent of Bloem’s revenue is generated through corporate projects.

item.title: Singtel introduces new LVL UP plan tailored for young people
item.description: Source: Singtel website. The LVL UP plan is targeted at youths. Singtel introduced a new mobile plan called “LVL UP” for young adults, coinciding with the start of The PC Show 2017. The name, inspired by the gaming term “level up,” signifies advancement to higher levels of difficulty in games. This plan provides free upgrades for Singtel’s Youth Combo plans and additional data. This plan, available to students and full-time National Servicemen aged 26 and under, offers close to S$600 in savings over two years.

item.title: IIJ Global Solutions Singapore is now providing cloud monitoring services using CA Nimsoft Monitor for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description: IIJ Global Solutions Singapore, a subsidiary of a major Japanese internet and network solutions company, Internet Initiative Japan (IIJ) Group, has incorporated CA Nimsoft Monitor from CA Technologies into its cloud solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. This addition allows IIJ Global Solutions Singapore to offer its clients extensive 24/7 monitoring and reporting services. Using this unified monitoring platform from CA Nimsoft Monitor, users can optimize resources, improve planning and investments, and reduce time spent on troubleshooting.

item.title: The Air by crazybaby (NANO) is now offered in 10 different colors
item.description: Source: Hwee Seng Electronics. Air by crazybaby (NANO) is available in 10 colours. Hwee Seng Electronics, a Singaporean distributor specializing in audio electronics, has become the official distributor for Crazybaby, a provider of high-quality audio devices. Their product, Air by crazybaby (NANO), also called Nano, is now available in Singapore through Hwee Seng Electronics. Nano earbuds combine Crazybaby’s modern and stylish look with a water-resistant build. These earbuds utilize carbon nanotube technology, which produces sound differently than traditional methods and generally doesn’t need moving parts.

item.title: A more nutritious choice of French-Vietnamese cuisine in Tanjong Pagar
item.description: Source: L’euphởriz. The L’euphởriz sautéed beef and spring rolls vermicelli salad (bún bò xào chả giò). L’euphởriz, a Vietnamese eatery located in Singapore’s Tanjong Pagar financial area, serves both lunch and dinner. The name “L’euphởriz” is a clever fusion of “L’euphorie” (French for “euphoria”), “phở” (the famous Vietnamese noodle soup), and “riz” (French for “rice”), hinting at the restaurant’s French-Vietnamese roots. With origins in Saigon, Vietnam, the restaurant later established itself in Paris and played a key role in the three-decade success of Parisian Vietnamese restaurant Dong Huong.
